title.raw: 《魯周公世家》 House of Lu Zhougong

sentences.zh: 周公旦者，周武王弟也。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou (Dan) was the younger brother of King Wu of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou, whose name was Dan, was King Wu's younger brother.

sentences.zh: 自文王在時，旦為子孝，篤仁，異於群子。

translations.literal: Even during King Wen's lifetime, Dan was exceptionally filial as a son, sincerely benevolent, and distinguished from his brothers.
translations.idiomatic: Even while King Wen was alive, Dan was extraordinarily filial, deeply benevolent, and stood out from his brothers.

sentences.zh: 及武王即位，旦常輔翼武王，用事居多。

translations.literal: After King Wu ascended the throne, Dan constantly assisted him and handled most of the affairs of state.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu ascended the throne, Dan was constantly at his side, taking charge of most government affairs.

sentences.zh: 武王九年，東伐至盟津，周公輔行。

translations.literal: In King Wu's ninth year, during the eastern campaign that reached Mengjin, the Duke of Zhou assisted with the expedition.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wu's ninth year, during the eastern campaign that reached Mengjin, the Duke of Zhou accompanied and assisted the expedition.

sentences.zh: 十一年，伐紂，至牧野，周公佐武王，作牧誓。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, during the attack on Zhou that reached Muye, the Duke of Zhou assisted King Wu and composed the Oath of Mu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, during the campaign against Zhou that reached Muye, the Duke of Zhou assisted King Wu and composed the Battle Oath.

sentences.zh: 破殷，入商宮。

translations.literal: They defeated Yin and entered the Shang palace.
translations.idiomatic: They defeated Yin and entered the Shang palace.

sentences.zh: 已殺紂，周公把大鉞，召公把小鉞，以夾武王，釁社，告紂之罪于天，及殷民。

translations.literal: After killing Zhou, the Duke of Zhou held the great axe, Duke Shao held the small axe, flanking King Wu. They smeared blood on the altar and proclaimed Zhou's crimes to heaven and the Yin people.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhou was killed, the Duke of Zhou held the great battle-axe and Duke Shao the small one, standing on either side of King Wu. They smeared the altar with blood and proclaimed Zhou's crimes to heaven and the Yin people.

sentences.zh: 釋箕子之囚。

translations.literal: They released Ji Zi from prison.
translations.idiomatic: They freed Ji Zi from imprisonment.

sentences.zh: 封紂子武庚祿父，使管叔、蔡叔傅之，以續殷祀。

translations.literal: They enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lufu, appointing Guan Shu and Cai Shu to tutor him and continue the Yin sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: They enfeoffed Zhou's son Wu Geng Lufu, appointing Guan Shu and Cai Shu as his tutors to continue the Yin sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 遍封功臣同姓戚者。

translations.literal: They extensively enfeoffed meritorious officials and same-surname relatives.
translations.idiomatic: They widely enfeoffed meritorious officials and same-surname kin.

sentences.zh: 封周公旦於少昊之虛曲阜，是為魯公。

translations.literal: They enfeoffed the Duke of Zhou Dan at Shaohao's ancient site in Qufu, making him Duke of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: They enfeoffed the Duke of Zhou Dan at Shaohao's ancient site in Qufu, making him Duke of Lu.

sentences.zh: 周公不就封，留佐武王。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou declined the enfeoffment and remained to assist King Wu.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou declined the enfeoffment and remained to assist King Wu.

sentences.zh: 武王克殷二年，天下未集，武王有疾，不豫，群臣懼，太公、召公乃繆卜。

translations.literal: In the second year after King Wu conquered Yin, the world was not yet pacified. King Wu fell ill and was not cheerful. The ministers were fearful, so the Grand Duke and Duke Shao performed false divinations.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year after King Wu conquered Yin, the world remained unsettled. King Wu fell gravely ill. The ministers were terrified, so the Grand Duke and Duke Shao performed secret divinations.

sentences.zh: 周公曰：「未可以戚我先王。」

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou said: 'One cannot yet grieve our former kings.'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou said: 'It is not yet time to grieve our former kings.'

sentences.zh: 周公於是乃自以為質，設三壇，周公北面立，戴璧秉圭，告于太王、王季、文王。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou therefore offered himself as pledge, setting up three altars. The Duke of Zhou stood facing north, wearing a jade disk and holding a jade tablet, and informed King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou therefore offered himself as hostage, setting up three altars. He stood facing north, wearing a jade disk and holding a jade tablet, and prayed to King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen.

sentences.zh: 史策祝曰：「惟爾元孫王發，勤勞阻疾。

translations.literal: The scribe's bamboo slips read in prayer: 'Your eldest grandson King Fa has labored with difficulty and illness.
translations.idiomatic: The scribe's written prayer said: 'Your eldest grandson King Fa has toiled with hardship and fallen ill.'

sentences.zh: 若爾三王是有負子之責於天，以旦代王發之身。

translations.literal: If you three kings bear responsibility for your son to heaven, let Dan substitute for King Fa's body.
translations.idiomatic: If you three kings bear responsibility to heaven for your son, let Dan take King Fa's place.'

sentences.zh: 旦巧能，多材多藝，能事鬼神。

translations.literal: Dan is skillful and able, with many talents and arts, able to serve the ghosts and spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Dan is skillful and capable, with many talents and skills, able to serve the spirits.'

sentences.zh: 乃王發不如旦多材多藝，不能事鬼神。

translations.literal: King Fa is not equal to Dan in many talents and arts, and cannot serve the ghosts and spirits.
translations.idiomatic: King Fa is not Dan's equal in talents and skills, and cannot serve the spirits.'

sentences.zh: 乃命于帝庭，敷佑四方，用能定汝子孫于下地，四方之民罔不敬畏。

translations.literal: Heaven commanded at the imperial court, spreading aid to the four directions, thereby able to settle your descendants on the earth below. The people of the four directions, none are not respectful and fearful.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven commanded in the imperial court, extending protection to all four quarters, thus enabling your descendants to be established on the earth below. The peoples of the four quarters, none fail to be respectful and fearful.

sentences.zh: 無墜天之降葆命，我先王亦永有所依歸。

translations.literal: Heaven commanded at the imperial court, spreading aid to the four directions, thereby able to settle your descendants on the earth below. The people of the four directions, none are not respectful and fearful.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven commanded in the imperial court, extending protection to all four quarters, thus enabling your descendants to be established on the earth below. The peoples of the four quarters, none fail to be respectful and fearful.

sentences.zh: 今我其即命於元龜，爾之許我，我以其璧與圭歸，以俟爾命。

translations.literal: Do not let fall heaven's descended protecting mandate. Our former kings will also eternally have somewhere to depend and return.
translations.idiomatic: Do not let heaven's protecting mandate fall. Our former kings will eternally have a place to depend on and return to.

sentences.zh: 爾不許我，我乃屏璧與圭。」

translations.literal: Now I will immediately divine with the great turtle. If you permit me, I will return with the jade disk and tablet to await your command.
translations.idiomatic: Now I will immediately consult the great turtle. If you approve, I will return with the jade disk and tablet to await your command.

sentences.zh: 周公已令史策告太王、王季、文王，欲代武王發，於是乃即三王而卜。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou had already ordered the scribe to inform King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen on the bamboo slips of his wish to substitute for King Wu (Fa). He then approached the three kings and performed divination.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou had already ordered the scribe to inform King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen on the bamboo slips of his desire to substitute for King Wu Fa. He then approached the three kings and performed divination.

sentences.zh: 卜人皆曰吉，發書視之，信吉。

translations.literal: All the diviners said it was auspicious. When they opened the slips and viewed them, it was truly auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: All the diviners declared it auspicious. When they opened the slips to examine them, they were indeed favorable.

sentences.zh: 周公喜，開籥，乃見書遇吉。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou was happy. When he opened the chest, he saw that the slips had encountered auspicious omens.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou rejoiced. When he opened the chest, he saw that the slips showed favorable omens.

sentences.zh: 周公入賀武王曰：「王其無害。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou entered and congratulated King Wu, saying: 'Your Majesty will be unharmed.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou entered and congratulated King Wu, saying: 'Your Majesty will come to no harm.'

sentences.zh: 旦新受命三王，維長終是圖。

translations.literal: Dan has newly received the command of the three kings, planning only for long-term completion.
translations.idiomatic: Dan has newly received the mandate of the three kings, and plans only for lasting accomplishment.

sentences.zh: 茲道能念予一人。」

translations.literal: This way can you consider me, this one person.'
translations.idiomatic: In this way can you show concern for me, this single person.'

sentences.zh: 周公藏其策金縢匱中，誡守者勿敢言。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou hid the slips in a gold-wrapped box and warned the guardians not to dare speak of it.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou hid the slips in a gold-bound casket and warned the keepers not to speak of it.

sentences.zh: 明日，武王有瘳。

translations.literal: The next day, King Wu recovered.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, King Wu recovered.

sentences.zh: 其後武王既崩，成王少，在彊葆之中。

translations.literal: After this, King Wu died. King Cheng was young and under strong protection.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, King Wu died. King Cheng was young and under heavy guard.

sentences.zh: 周公恐天下聞武王崩而畔，周公乃踐阼代成王攝行政當國。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou feared that if the world heard of King Wu's death they would rebel. The Duke of Zhou therefore ascended the throne and substituted for King Cheng, administering the government and governing the state.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou feared that if the world learned of King Wu's death they would revolt. The Duke of Zhou therefore ascended the throne and acted as regent for King Cheng, administering government and ruling the state.

sentences.zh: 管叔及其群弟流言於國曰：「周公將不利於成王。」

translations.literal: Guan Shu and his brothers spread rumors throughout the state, saying: 'The Duke of Zhou will bring harm to King Cheng.'
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu and his brothers spread slander throughout the state, saying: 'The Duke of Zhou intends harm to King Cheng.'

sentences.zh: 周公乃告太公望、召公奭曰：「我之所以弗辟而攝行政者，恐天下畔周，無以告我先王太王、王季、文王。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou then informed the Grand Duke and Duke Shao, saying: 'The reason I do not withdraw but administer the government is that I fear the world will revolt against Zhou, and I will have nothing with which to report to my former kings King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou then told the Grand Duke and Duke Shao: 'The reason I do not step aside but take charge of government is that I fear the world will rebel against Zhou, leaving me with nothing to say to my ancestors King Tai, King Ji, and King Wen.'

sentences.zh: 三王之憂勞天下久矣，於今而后成。

translations.literal: The three kings have long worried and toiled for the world. Only now can it be accomplished.
translations.idiomatic: The three kings have long been concerned and labored for the world. Only now will it be completed.

sentences.zh: 武王蚤終，成王少，將以成周，我所以為之若此。」

translations.literal: King Wu died prematurely. King Cheng is young. He will accomplish Zhou. This is why I do it like this.'
translations.idiomatic: King Wu died too early. King Cheng is young. He will complete Zhou. This is why I act as I do.'

sentences.zh: 於是卒相成王，而使其子伯禽代就封於魯。

translations.literal: He therefore continued to assist King Cheng, and sent his son Bo Qin to accept the enfeoffment at Lu in his place.
translations.idiomatic: He therefore continued to serve as King Cheng's chancellor, and sent his son Bo Qin to accept the enfeoffment at Lu in his stead.

sentences.zh: 周公戒伯禽曰：「我文王之子，武王之弟，成王之叔父，我於天下亦不賤矣。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou admonished Bo Qin, saying: 'I am King Wen's son, King Wu's younger brother, King Cheng's uncle. I am not lowly in the world.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou warned Bo Qin: 'I am King Wen's son, King Wu's brother, King Cheng's uncle. I am not insignificant in the world.'

sentences.zh: 然我一沐三捉發，一飯三吐哺，起以待士，猶恐失天下之賢人。

translations.literal: Yet I, once bathing, thrice grasp my hair; once eating, thrice spit out my food; rise to receive scholars, still fearing to lose the world's worthy men.
translations.idiomatic: Yet I, once bathing, thrice seize my hair; once eating, thrice spit out my food; rise to greet scholars, still fearing to miss the world's talented people.

sentences.zh: 子之魯，慎無以國驕人。」

translations.literal: When you go to Lu, be careful not to be arrogant because of your state.'
translations.idiomatic: When you go to Lu, do not become arrogant toward people because of your position.'

sentences.zh: 管、蔡、武庚等果率淮夷而反。

translations.literal: Guan Shu, Cai Shu, Wu Geng, and others indeed led the Huai barbarians and rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Shu, Cai Shu, Wu Geng, and others indeed led the Huai Yi tribes in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 周公乃奉成王命，興師東伐，作大誥。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou then received King Cheng's command, raised troops for an eastern campaign, and composed the Great Announcement.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou then acted on King Cheng's orders, mobilized forces for an eastern campaign, and composed the Great Declaration.

sentences.zh: 遂誅管叔，殺武庚，放蔡叔。

translations.literal: He then executed Guan Shu, killed Wu Geng, and exiled Cai Shu.
translations.idiomatic: He then put Guan Shu to death, killed Wu Geng, and banished Cai Shu.

sentences.zh: 收殷餘民，以封康叔於衛，封微子於宋，以奉殷祀。

translations.literal: He gathered the remaining Yin people, enfeoffed Kang Shu at Wei, enfeoffed Wei Zi at Song, to continue the Yin sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: He gathered the surviving Yin populace, enfeoffed Kang Shu at Wei, enfeoffed Wei Zi at Song, to maintain the Yin sacrificial rites.

sentences.zh: 寧淮夷東土，二年而畢定。

translations.literal: He pacified the Huai barbarians in the eastern lands. In two years it was completely settled.
translations.idiomatic: He pacified the Huai Yi in the east. In two years it was fully settled.

sentences.zh: 諸侯咸服宗周。

translations.literal: All the feudal lords submitted to and revered Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: All the feudal lords submitted to and honored Zhou.

sentences.zh: 天降祉福，唐叔得禾，異母同穎，獻之成王，成王命唐叔以餽周公於東土，作餽禾。

translations.literal: Heaven sent down blessings and good fortune. Tang Shu obtained grain with two stalks from one root and the same ear. He presented it to King Cheng. King Cheng ordered Tang Shu to present it as a gift to the Duke of Zhou in the eastern lands, composing the Presentation of Grain.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven bestowed blessings and prosperity. Tang Shu obtained grain with two stalks from one root sharing the same ear. He presented it to King Cheng. King Cheng commanded Tang Shu to offer it as a tribute to the Duke of Zhou in the eastern territories, composing the Grain Tribute.

sentences.zh: 周公既受命禾，嘉天子命，作嘉禾。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou having received the commanded grain, praised the Son of Heaven's command, and composed the Praising Grain.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou having received the grain tribute, commended the king's command, and composed the Grain Praise.

sentences.zh: 東土以集，周公歸報成王，乃為詩貽王，命之曰鴟鸮。

translations.literal: The eastern lands being gathered, the Duke of Zhou returned and reported to King Cheng. He then made a poem to present to the king, naming it the Owl.
translations.idiomatic: The eastern territories having been pacified, the Duke of Zhou returned and reported to King Cheng. He then composed a poem to present to the king, calling it the Owl.

sentences.zh: 王亦未敢訓周公。

translations.literal: The king also did not yet dare to rebuke the Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The king also did not yet dare to reprove the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 成王七年二月乙未，王朝步自周，至豐，使太保召公先之雒相土。

translations.literal: In King Cheng's seventh year, second month, day yiwei, the king walked from morning court at Zhou to Feng, sending the Grand Protector Duke Shao ahead to Luo to survey the land.
translations.idiomatic: In King Cheng's seventh year, on the yiwei day of the second month, the king walked from Zhou to Feng, sending the Grand Protector Duke Shao ahead to Luo to inspect the site.

sentences.zh: 其三月，周公往營成周雒邑，卜居焉，曰吉，遂國之。

translations.literal: In the third month, the Duke of Zhou went to plan Chengzhou Luoyi, divined about residing there, said it was auspicious, and so established the capital there.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the Duke of Zhou went to plan the city of Chengzhou at Luoyi, consulted the oracle about settling there, declared it favorable, and so made it the capital.

sentences.zh: 成王長，能聽政。

translations.literal: King Cheng grew up and could listen to government.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng matured and could attend to governance.

sentences.zh: 於是周公乃還政於成王，成王臨朝。

translations.literal: Thereupon the Duke of Zhou then returned the government to King Cheng, and King Cheng held court.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Duke of Zhou returned power to King Cheng, who took his place at court.

sentences.zh: 周公之代成王治，南面倍依以朝諸侯。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou substituting for King Cheng in governing, faced south and leaned on the armrest to receive the feudal lords in audience.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou, acting as regent for King Cheng, sat facing south and leaned on the armrest to receive the feudal lords in court.

sentences.zh: 及七年後，還政成王，北面就臣位，匔匔如畏然。

translations.literal: When seven years had passed, he returned the government to King Cheng, faced north and took his position as minister, trembling as if in fear.
translations.idiomatic: When seven years had passed, he returned power to King Cheng, faced north and assumed his position as minister, trembling as if afraid.

sentences.zh: 初，成王少時，病，周公乃自揃其蚤沈之河，以祝於神曰：「王少未有識，奸神命者乃旦也。」

translations.literal: Initially, when King Cheng was young and ill, the Duke of Zhou cut his own fingernails and sank them in the river, praying to the spirits: 'The king is young and has no discernment. The one who violates the spirits' command is Dan.'
translations.idiomatic: At first, when King Cheng was young and fell ill, the Duke of Zhou cut his own fingernails and threw them into the river, praying to the spirits: 'The king is young and lacks judgment. The one who offends the spirits' will is Dan.'

sentences.zh: 亦藏其策於府。

translations.literal: He also hid the prayer slips in the treasury.
translations.idiomatic: He also concealed the prayer slips in the archives.

sentences.zh: 成王病有瘳。

translations.literal: King Cheng's illness improved.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng's illness was cured.

sentences.zh: 及成王用事，人或譖周公，周公奔楚。

translations.literal: When King Cheng took charge of affairs, someone slandered the Duke of Zhou, and the Duke of Zhou fled to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: When King Cheng assumed power, someone slandered the Duke of Zhou, causing him to flee to Chu.

sentences.zh: 成王發府，見周公禱書，乃泣，反周公。

translations.literal: King Cheng opened the treasury and saw the Duke of Zhou's prayer slips, then wept and recalled the Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng opened the archives and saw the Duke of Zhou's prayer, then wept and summoned him back.

sentences.zh: 周公歸，恐成王壯，治有所淫佚，乃作多士，作毋逸。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou returned, fearing that when King Cheng matured, his governance might become indulgent and dissipated, and so composed the Many Officers and composed the Do Not Indulge.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou returned, fearing that when King Cheng grew up, his rule might become dissolute and self-indulgent, so he composed the Many Officers and the Do Not Indulge.

sentences.zh: 毋逸稱：「為人父母，為業至長久，子孫驕奢忘之，以亡其家，為人子可不慎乎！

translations.literal: The Do Not Indulge states: 'As parents of the people, the enterprise is exceedingly long-lasting. Descendants become arrogant and extravagant and forget it, thus destroying their families. As children of such parents, can we not be careful?
translations.idiomatic: The Do Not Indulge declares: 'As rulers of the people, the task is extremely long-term. Descendants grow arrogant and extravagant and forget this, thus ruining their houses. As their children, can we not be cautious?'

sentences.zh: 笔昔在殷王中宗，嚴恭敬畏天命，自度治民，震懼不敢荒寧，故中宗饗國七十五年。

translations.literal: In the past, under Yin King Zhong Zong, he was strict, respectful, and feared heaven's mandate. He measured himself in governing the people, trembling and not daring to neglect his duties, therefore Zhong Zong enjoyed the state for seventy-five years.
translations.idiomatic: In former times, under Yin King Zhong Zong, he was solemn, reverent, and feared heaven's command. He restrained himself in ruling the people, trembling and not daring to be idle, therefore Zhong Zong reigned over the state for seventy-five years.

sentences.zh: 其在高宗，久勞于外，為與小人，作其即位，乃有亮闇，三年不言，言乃讙，不敢荒寧，密靖殷國，至于小大無怨，故高宗饗國五十五年。

translations.literal: As for Gao Zong, he long toiled abroad, living with commoners. When he ascended the throne, he had a period of mourning silence, three years without speaking. When he spoke, it was thunderous. He did not dare neglect his duties, quietly pacifying Yin, so that from great to small none complained. Therefore Gao Zong enjoyed the state for fifty-five years.
translations.idiomatic: As for Gao Zong, he long labored abroad, dwelling among the common people. When he ascended the throne, he observed mourning seclusion, three years without speaking. When he spoke, it was with great impact. He did not dare be idle, quietly bringing peace to Yin, so that from noble to humble none had grievances. Therefore Gao Zong reigned over the state for fifty-five years.

sentences.zh: 其在祖甲，不義惟王，久為小人于外，知小人之依，能保施小民，不侮寡，故祖甲饗國三十三年。」

translations.literal: As for Zu Jia, he was not righteous only as king, long serving as a commoner abroad. He understood the commoners' dependence, could protect and benefit the small people, not insulting the orphaned. Therefore Zu Jia enjoyed the state for thirty-three years.'
translations.idiomatic: As for Zu Jia, he was unrighteous only as king, long serving as a commoner abroad. He understood the commoners' reliance, could safeguard and benefit the humble people, not despising the solitary. Therefore Zu Jia reigned over the state for thirty-three years.'

sentences.zh: 多士稱曰：「自湯至于帝乙，無不率祀明德，帝無不配天者。

translations.literal: The Many Officers states: 'From Tang to Di Yi, none failed to follow the sacrifices and illuminate virtue. None of the emperors failed to match heaven.
translations.idiomatic: The Many Officers declares: 'From Tang to Di Yi, none failed to conduct the sacrifices and manifest virtue. None of the emperors failed to accord with heaven.'

sentences.zh: 在今後嗣王紂，誕淫厥佚，不顧天及民之從也。

translations.literal: As for the present successor king Zhou, he greatly indulged in licentiousness and dissipation, not considering heaven and the people's obedience.
translations.idiomatic: As for the current successor king Zhou, he extensively indulged in debauchery and dissipation, disregarding heaven and the people's allegiance.'

sentences.zh: 其民皆可誅。」

translations.literal: All his people could be executed.'
translations.idiomatic: All his subjects deserved execution.'

sentences.zh: （周多士）「文王日中昃不暇食，饗國五十年。」

translations.literal: (The Many Officers of Zhou) 'King Wen, even when the sun declined at noon, had no leisure to eat, and enjoyed the state for fifty years.'
translations.idiomatic: (The Zhou Many Officers) 'King Wen, even when the sun was past noon, had no time to eat, and reigned over the state for fifty years.'

sentences.zh: 作此以誡成王。

translations.literal: He composed this to admonish King Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: He wrote this to warn King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成王在豐，天下已安，周之官政未次序，於是周公作周官，官別其宜，作立政，以便百姓。

translations.literal: King Cheng was at Feng. The world was already peaceful. Zhou's official administration was not yet ordered. Thereupon the Duke of Zhou composed the Zhou Officials, distinguishing officials according to their suitability, and composed the Establishing Government, to benefit the common people.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng was at Feng. The world was already at peace. Zhou's governmental administration was not yet organized. Thereupon the Duke of Zhou composed the Zhou Officials, assigning officials according to their appropriateness, and composed the Establishing Governance, to serve the common people.

sentences.zh: 百姓說。

translations.literal: The common people were pleased.
translations.idiomatic: The common people were delighted.

sentences.zh: 周公在豐，病，將沒，曰：「必葬我成周，以明吾不敢離成王。」

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou was at Feng and fell ill, about to die, saying: 'You must bury me at Chengzhou, to show that I dared not separate from King Cheng.'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou was at Feng and fell ill, near death, saying: 'You must bury me at Chengzhou, to demonstrate that I dared not abandon King Cheng.'

sentences.zh: 周公既卒，成王亦讓，葬周公於畢，從文王，以明予小子不敢臣周公也。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou having died, King Cheng also declined, burying the Duke of Zhou at Bi, following King Wen, to show that I, the young one, dared not treat the Duke of Zhou as a minister.
translations.idiomatic: After the Duke of Zhou died, King Cheng also demurred, burying the Duke of Zhou at Bi, following King Wen, to demonstrate that I, the young one, dared not regard the Duke of Zhou as a subject.

sentences.zh: 周公卒後，秋未穫，暴風雷［雨］，禾盡偃，大木盡拔。

translations.literal: After the Duke of Zhou died, in autumn before the harvest, a violent wind, thunder, and rain occurred, the grain all lay flat, and the great trees were all uprooted.
translations.idiomatic: After the Duke of Zhou died, in autumn before the harvest was reaped, a violent storm with thunder and rain struck, flattening all the grain and uprooting all the great trees.

sentences.zh: 周國大恐。

translations.literal: The state of Zhou was greatly terrified.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou state was thrown into great fear.

sentences.zh: 成王與大夫朝服以開金縢書，王乃得周公所自以為功代武王之說。

translations.literal: King Cheng, together with the grandees in court robes, opened the gold-bound casket. The king then obtained the Duke of Zhou's words about how he had taken upon himself the guilt to substitute for King Wu.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng, together with the high officials in their court robes, opened the gold-bound casket. The king then learned of the Duke of Zhou's account of how he had taken upon himself the blame to substitute for King Wu.

sentences.zh: 二公及王乃問史百執事，史百執事曰：「信有，昔周公命我勿敢言。」

translations.literal: The two dukes and the king then questioned the Scribe of the Hundred Officials. The Scribe of the Hundred Officials said: 'It is true. Formerly the Duke of Zhou commanded me not to dare speak of it.'
translations.idiomatic: The two dukes and the king then questioned the Scribe of the Hundred Officers. The Scribe of the Hundred Officers said: 'It is indeed true. In the past the Duke of Zhou commanded me not to dare speak of it.'

sentences.zh: 成王執書以泣，曰：「自今後其無繆卜乎！

translations.literal: King Cheng held the slips and wept, saying: 'From now on there will be no more false divinations!
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng held the slips and wept, saying: 'From now on there will be no more erroneous divinations!

sentences.zh: 昔周公勤勞王家，惟予幼人弗及知。

translations.literal: Formerly the Duke of Zhou toiled diligently for the royal house. Only I, the young one, did not get to know it.
translations.idiomatic: In the past the Duke of Zhou labored tirelessly for the royal family. Only I, the young one, failed to understand it.

sentences.zh: 今天動威以彰周公之德，惟朕小子其迎，我國家禮亦宜之。」

translations.literal: Now heaven has moved its awe-inspiring power to manifest the Duke of Zhou's virtue. Only my young self should welcome it. Our state's rites also make it appropriate.'
translations.idiomatic: Now heaven has displayed its awesome power to reveal the Duke of Zhou's virtue. Only I, this young one, should welcome it. Our nation's rituals also deem it proper.'

sentences.zh: 王出郊，天乃雨，反風，禾盡起。

translations.literal: The king went out to the suburbs. Heaven then rained. The wind reversed direction. The grain all stood up.
translations.idiomatic: The king went out to the suburbs. Heaven then sent rain. The wind changed direction. All the grain stood upright.

sentences.zh: 二公命國人，凡大木所偃，盡起而筑之。

translations.literal: The two dukes commanded the people of the state: wherever great trees had been laid low, all were to stand them up and buttress them.
translations.idiomatic: The two dukes commanded the people of the state: wherever great trees had fallen, all were to be raised up and propped.

sentences.zh: 歲則大孰。

translations.literal: The year then had a great harvest.
translations.idiomatic: The year then produced an abundant harvest.

sentences.zh: 於是成王乃命魯得郊祭文王。

translations.literal: Thereupon King Cheng then commanded that Lu should be permitted to perform the suburban sacrifice to King Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon King Cheng then decreed that Lu should be allowed to perform the suburban sacrifice to King Wen.

sentences.zh: 魯有天子禮樂者，以褒周公之德也。

translations.literal: Lu having the rites and music of the Son of Heaven was to honor the Duke of Zhou's virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Lu possessing the rituals and music of the Son of Heaven was to praise the Duke of Zhou's virtue.

sentences.zh: 周公卒，子伯禽固已前受封，是為魯公。

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou died. His son Bo Qin had already previously received the enfeoffment. He became Duke of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou died. His son Bo Qin had already received the enfeoffment earlier. He became Duke of Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯公伯禽之初受封之魯，三年而後報政周公。

translations.literal: When Duke Bo Qin of Lu first received his enfeoffment at Lu, it was three years later that he reported on governance to the Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Bo Qin of Lu first received his enfeoffment at Lu, it was three years later that he reported on administration to the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公曰：「何遲也？」

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou said: 'Why so late?'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou said: 'Why so delayed?'

sentences.zh: 伯禽曰：「變其俗，革其禮，喪三年然後除之，故遲。」

translations.literal: Bo Qin said: 'I changed their customs, reformed their rites. Mourning lasts three years before it is ended. Therefore it is late.'
translations.idiomatic: Bo Qin said: 'I altered their customs, reformed their rituals. The mourning period lasts three years before it concludes. Therefore it is delayed.'

sentences.zh: 太公亦封於齊，五月而報政周公。

translations.literal: The Grand Duke was also enfeoffed at Qi. In five months he reported on governance to the Duke of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Duke was also enfeoffed at Qi. In five months he reported on administration to the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公曰：「何疾也？」

translations.literal: The Duke of Zhou said: 'Why so fast?'
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou said: 'Why so quick?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「吾簡其君臣禮，從其俗為也。」

translations.literal: He said: 'I simplified their ruler and minister rites. I followed their customs to do it.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'I simplified their rituals between ruler and ministers. I followed their customs in doing so.'

sentences.zh: 及後聞伯禽報政遲，乃嘆曰：「嗚呼，魯後世其北面事齊矣！

translations.literal: When later he heard that Bo Qin reported on governance late, he sighed and said: 'Alas, Lu's later generations will face north and serve Qi!
translations.idiomatic: When later he heard that Bo Qin reported on administration with delay, he sighed and said: 'Alas, Lu's future generations will face north and serve Qi!

sentences.zh: 夫政不簡不易，民不有近；

translations.literal: Indeed, governance that is not simple and easy, the people will not draw near;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, administration that is not simple and easy, the people will not approach;

sentences.zh: 平易近民，民必歸之。」

translations.literal: Level and easy, close to the people, the people will surely return to it.'
translations.idiomatic: Simple and approachable, near to the people, the people will surely turn to it.'

sentences.zh: 伯禽即位之後，有管、蔡等反也，淮夷、徐戎亦并興反。

translations.literal: After Bo Qin took the throne, there was the rebellion of Guan Shu, Cai Shu, and others. The Huai barbarians and Xu Rong also rose up together in rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: After Bo Qin ascended the throne, there was the revolt of Guan Shu, Cai Shu, and others. The Huai Yi and Xu Rong also rose together in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 於是伯禽率師伐之於肸，作肸誓，曰：「陳爾甲胄，無敢不善。

translations.literal: Thereupon Bo Qin led troops to attack them at Fei, composing the Fei Oath, saying: 'Array your armor and helmets. None dare be not good.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Bo Qin led forces to attack them at Fei, composing the Fei Oath, saying: 'Deploy your armor and helmets. None dare be not virtuous.'

sentences.zh: 無敢傷牿。

translations.literal: None dare wound the wounded.
translations.idiomatic: None dare harm the injured.

sentences.zh: 馬牛其風，臣妾逋逃，勿敢越逐，敬復之。

translations.literal: Horses and oxen in their frenzy, male and female servants fleeing, do not dare cross boundaries in pursuit, respectfully return them.
translations.idiomatic: Horses and oxen in their panic, servants fleeing, do not dare pursue beyond boundaries, respectfully restore them.

sentences.zh: 無敢寇攘，踰墻垣。

translations.literal: None dare plunder and seize, cross over walls and ramparts.
translations.idiomatic: None dare rob and steal, climb over walls and fortifications.

sentences.zh: 魯人三郊三隧，峙爾芻茭、糗糧、楨榦，無敢不逮。

translations.literal: Lu people three suburbs three tunnels, prepare your fodder and hay, dried provisions and grain, bridge beams and posts. None dare not reach.
translations.idiomatic: Lu people through three suburbs and three tunnels, prepare your forage and hay, dried rations and grain, bridge timbers and posts. None dare fail to arrive.

sentences.zh: 我甲戌筑而征徐戎，無敢不及，有大刑。」

translations.literal: I on jiayin day built fortifications and campaigned against the Xu Rong. None dare not arrive. There is great punishment.'
translations.idiomatic: I on the jiayin day built fortifications and attacked the Xu Rong. None dare fail to arrive. There is severe punishment.'

sentences.zh: 作此肸誓，遂平徐戎，定魯。

translations.literal: Having composed this Fei Oath, he then pacified the Xu Rong and settled Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Having composed this Fei Oath, he then subdued the Xu Rong and established Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯公伯禽卒，子考公酋立。

translations.literal: Duke Bo Qin of Lu died. His son, Duke Kao Qiu, ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Bo Qin of Lu died. His son, Duke Kao Qiu, succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 考公四年卒，立弟熙，是謂煬公。

translations.literal: Duke Kao died in his fourth year. His younger brother Xi ascended. This is Duke Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Kao died in his fourth year. His younger brother Xi succeeded him. He is called Duke Yang.

sentences.zh: 煬公筑茅闕門。

translations.literal: Duke Yang built the Thatched Tower Gate.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yang constructed the Thatched Tower Gate.

sentences.zh: 六年卒，子幽公宰立。

translations.literal: He died in his sixth year. His son Duke You Tsai ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in his sixth year. His son Duke You Tsai succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 幽公十四年。

translations.literal: Duke You's fourteenth year.
translations.idiomatic: Duke You's fourteenth year.

sentences.zh: 幽公弟沸殺幽公而自立，是為魏公。

translations.literal: Duke You's younger brother Fei killed Duke You and established himself. This is Duke Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Duke You's younger brother Fei assassinated Duke You and took the throne himself. He is called Duke Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏公五十年卒，子厲公擢立。

translations.literal: Duke Wei died in his fiftieth year. His son Duke Li Zhuo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wei died in his fiftieth year. His son Duke Li Zhuo succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 厲公三十七年卒，魯人立其弟具，是為獻公。

translations.literal: Duke Li died in his thirty-seventh year. The people of Lu established his younger brother Ju. This is Duke Xian.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li died in his thirty-seventh year. The people of Lu installed his younger brother Ju. He is called Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公三十二年卒，子真公濞立。

translations.literal: Duke Xian died in his thirty-second year. His son Duke Zhen Pi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian died in his thirty-second year. His son Duke Zhen Pi succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 真公十四年，周厲王無道，出奔彘，共和行政。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhen's fourteenth year, King Li of Zhou was without the Way, fled to Zhi, and the Gonghe administered government.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhen's fourteenth year, King Li of Zhou acted tyrannically, fled to Zhi, and the Gonghe administered the government.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，周宣王即位。

translations.literal: In his twenty-ninth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In his twenty-ninth year, King Xuan of Zhou took the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十年，真公卒，弟敖立，是為武公。

translations.literal: In his thirtieth year, Duke Zhen died. His younger brother Ao ascended. This is Duke Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In his thirtieth year, Duke Zhen died. His younger brother Ao succeeded him. He is called Duke Wu.

sentences.zh: 武公九年春，武公與長子括，少子戲，西朝周宣王。

translations.literal: In Duke Wu's ninth year, spring, Duke Wu together with his eldest son Kuo and youngest son Xi, went west to court King Xuan of Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wu's ninth year, during spring, Duke Wu took his eldest son Kuo and youngest son Xi and went west to pay court to King Xuan of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 宣王愛戲，欲立戲為魯太子。

translations.literal: King Xuan loved Xi and wished to establish Xi as Lu's crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan favored Xi and wanted to make Xi the crown prince of Lu.

sentences.zh: 周之樊仲山父諫宣王曰：「廢長立少，不順；

translations.literal: Fan Zhong Shan Fu of Zhou admonished King Xuan, saying: 'Discarding the eldest and establishing the youngest is not orderly;
translations.idiomatic: Zhou's Fan Zhong Shan Fu advised King Xuan: 'To depose the elder and install the younger is improper;

sentences.zh: 不順，必犯王命；

translations.literal: Not orderly, will certainly violate the king's command;
translations.idiomatic: Improper, will certainly contravene the king's orders;

sentences.zh: 犯王命，必誅之：故出令不可不順也。

translations.literal: Violating the king's command, will certainly be punished: therefore issuing commands cannot but be orderly.
translations.idiomatic: To contravene the king's orders will certainly bring punishment: therefore commands issued must be proper.

sentences.zh: 令之不行，政之不立；

translations.literal: Commands not carried out, government not established;
translations.idiomatic: When commands are not followed, governance cannot be established;

sentences.zh: 行而不順，民將棄上。

translations.literal: Carried out but not orderly, the people will abandon their superiors.
translations.idiomatic: If followed but improper, the people will forsake their rulers.

sentences.zh: 夫下事上，少事長，所以為順。

translations.literal: Indeed, the lower serving the higher, the younger serving the elder, this is what makes for order.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, inferiors serving superiors, juniors serving seniors - this constitutes proper order.

sentences.zh: 今天子建諸侯，立其少，是教民逆也。

translations.literal: Now the Son of Heaven establishes feudal lords, setting up their youngest, this teaches the people to be contrary.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Son of Heaven appoints feudal lords, installing their youngest sons, this instructs the people in disobedience.

sentences.zh: 若魯從之，諸侯效之，王命將有所壅；

translations.literal: If Lu follows this, the feudal lords will imitate it, the king's commands will be obstructed;
translations.idiomatic: If Lu complies, the feudal lords will follow suit, the king's orders will be blocked;

sentences.zh: 若弗從而誅之，是自誅王命也。

translations.literal: If not following and punishing it, this is to punish the king's command oneself.
translations.idiomatic: If not complying and punishing it, this is to punish the king's own command.

sentences.zh: 誅之亦失，不誅亦失，王其圖之。」

translations.literal: Punishing it is also wrong, not punishing it is also wrong. Your Majesty should consider it.'
translations.idiomatic: To punish it would also be wrong, not to punish it would also be wrong. Your Majesty should reflect on this.'

sentences.zh: 宣王弗聽，卒立戲為魯太子。

translations.literal: King Xuan did not listen, and in the end established Xi as Lu's crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan would not heed the advice, and finally made Xi the crown prince of Lu.

sentences.zh: 夏，武公歸而卒，戲立，是為懿公。

translations.literal: In summer, Duke Wu returned and died. Xi ascended. This is Duke Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Wu returned home and died. Xi took the throne. He is called Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 懿公九年，懿公兄括之子伯御與魯人攻弒懿公，而立伯御為君。

translations.literal: In Duke Yi's ninth year, Duke Yi's elder brother Kuo's son Bo Yu, together with Lu people, attacked and assassinated Duke Yi, and established Bo Yu as ruler.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Yi's ninth year, Bo Yu (son of Duke Yi's elder brother Kuo) joined with Lu people to attack and kill Duke Yi, then installed Bo Yu as ruler.

sentences.zh: 伯御即位十一年，周宣王伐魯，殺其君伯御，而問魯公子能道順諸侯者，以為魯後。

translations.literal: Bo Yu took the throne for eleven years. King Xuan of Zhou attacked Lu, killed its ruler Bo Yu, and inquired among the Lu nobles who could guide and harmonize the feudal lords, to make him Lu's successor.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Yu reigned for eleven years. King Xuan of Zhou attacked Lu, executed its ruler Bo Yu, and sought among the Lu nobles one who could properly guide and harmonize relations with the feudal lords, to make him Lu's successor.

sentences.zh: 樊穆仲曰：「魯懿公弟稱，肅恭明神，敬事耆老；

translations.literal: Fan Mu Zhong said: 'Duke Yi of Lu's younger brother Cheng is solemn and respectful, enlightened about the spirits, respectful in serving the elders;
translations.idiomatic: Fan Mu Zhong said: 'Duke Yi of Lu's younger brother Cheng is reverent and serious, wise regarding the spirits, respectful toward the elderly;

sentences.zh: 賦事行刑，必問於遺訓而咨於固實；

translations.literal: In assigning duties and administering punishments, he certainly consults the ancestral teachings and seeks advice from established precedents;
translations.idiomatic: When assigning tasks and carrying out punishments, he always consults the inherited instructions and seeks counsel from reliable traditions;

sentences.zh: 不干所問，不犯所（知）［咨］。」

translations.literal: He does not interfere with what has been asked, does not violate what has been consulted.'
translations.idiomatic: He does not meddle with what has been inquired about, does not contravene what has been advised.'

sentences.zh: 宣王曰：「然，能訓治其民矣。」

translations.literal: King Xuan said: 'Yes, he can instruct and govern his people.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan said: 'Indeed, he can guide and rule his people.'

sentences.zh: 乃立稱於夷宮，是為孝公。

translations.literal: Thereupon he established Cheng in the Yi Palace. This is Duke Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he installed Cheng in the Yi Palace. He is called Duke Xiao.

sentences.zh: 自是後，諸侯多畔王命。

translations.literal: From this time afterward, the feudal lords frequently rebelled against the king's commands.
translations.idiomatic: After this, the feudal lords often defied the king's orders.

sentences.zh: 孝公二十五年，諸侯畔周，犬戎殺幽王。

translations.literal: In Duke Xiao's twenty-fifth year, the feudal lords rebelled against Zhou, and the Quan Rong killed King You.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiao's twenty-fifth year, the feudal lords revolted against Zhou, and the Quan Rong assassinated King You.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin began to be ranked as a feudal lord.
translations.idiomatic: Qin first became established as a feudal state.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，孝公卒，子弗湟立，是為惠公。

translations.literal: In his twenty-seventh year, Duke Xiao died. His son Fu Huang ascended. This is Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: In his twenty-seventh year, Duke Xiao died. His son Fu Huang succeeded him. He is called Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公三十年，晉人弒其君昭侯。

translations.literal: In Duke Hui's thirtieth year, the Jin people assassinated their ruler Duke Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui's thirtieth year, the people of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，晉人又弒其君孝侯。

translations.literal: In his forty-fifth year, the Jin people again assassinated their ruler Duke Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: In his forty-fifth year, the people of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Xiao once more.

sentences.zh: 四十六年，惠公卒，長庶子息攝當國，行君事，是為隱公。

translations.literal: In his forty-sixth year, Duke Hui died. His eldest son by a concubine Xi acted as regent and conducted the ruler's affairs. This is Duke Yin.
translations.idiomatic: In his forty-sixth year, Duke Hui died. His eldest concubine-born son Xi served as regent and performed the ruler's duties. He is called Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 初，惠公適夫人無子，公賤妾聲子生子息。

translations.literal: Initially, Duke Hui's proper wife had no sons. The duke's lowly concubine Sheng Zi gave birth to a son Xi.
translations.idiomatic: At first, Duke Hui's principal wife bore no children. The duke's humble concubine Sheng Zi gave birth to a son named Xi.

sentences.zh: 息長，為娶於宋。

translations.literal: When Xi grew up, he took a wife from Song.
translations.idiomatic: When Xi came of age, he married a woman from Song.

sentences.zh: 宋女至而好，惠公奪而自妻之。

translations.literal: The Song woman arrived and was beautiful. Duke Hui took her and made her his own wife.
translations.idiomatic: The woman from Song arrived and was lovely. Duke Hui appropriated her and took her as his wife.

sentences.zh: 生子允。

translations.literal: She gave birth to a son Yun.
translations.idiomatic: She bore a son named Yun.

sentences.zh: 登宋女為夫人，以允為太子。

translations.literal: He elevated the Song woman to be his wife, making Yun the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: He promoted the woman from Song to be his principal wife, establishing Yun as the heir apparent.

sentences.zh: 及惠公卒，為允少故，魯人共令息攝政，不言即位。

translations.literal: When Duke Hui died, because Yun was young, the people of Lu together commanded Xi to act as regent, not speaking of ascending the throne.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Hui died, because Yun was still young, the people of Lu jointly instructed Xi to serve as regent, without mentioning taking the throne.

sentences.zh: 隱公五年，觀漁於棠。

translations.literal: In Duke Yin's fifth year, he observed the fishing at Tang.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Yin's fifth year, he watched the fishing at Tang.

sentences.zh: 八年，與鄭易天子之太山之邑祊及許田，君子譏之。

translations.literal: In his eighth year, he exchanged with Zheng the king's Tai Mountain town of Beng and Xu Fields. The noble men criticized it.
translations.idiomatic: In his eighth year, he traded with Zheng the king's Tai Mountain town of Beng and Xu Fields. The gentlemen censured it.

sentences.zh: 十一年冬，公子揮諂謂隱公曰：「百姓便君，君其遂立。

translations.literal: In his eleventh year, winter, Prince Hui flattered Duke Yin, saying: 'The common people find you suitable, my lord. You should take the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In his eleventh year, during winter, Prince Hui fawned on Duke Yin, saying: 'The common people approve of you, my lord. You should assume the throne.

sentences.zh: 吾請為君殺子允，君以我為相。」

translations.literal: I beg to kill Prince Yun for you, my lord. Make me your chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: I request to kill Prince Yun for you, my lord. Appoint me as your chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 隱公曰：「有先君命。

translations.literal: Duke Yin said: 'There is the previous lord's command.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yin said: 'There is my father's command.

sentences.zh: 吾為允少，故攝代。

translations.literal: I acted as regent because Yun was young.
translations.idiomatic: I served as regent because Yun was still young.

sentences.zh: 今允長矣，吾方營菟裘之地而老焉，以授子允政。」

translations.literal: Now Yun has grown up. I am preparing the Tu Qiu lands to grow old there, handing over governance to Prince Yun.'
translations.idiomatic: Now Yun has matured. I am arranging the Tu Qiu lands to retire there, transferring power to Prince Yun.'

sentences.zh: 揮懼子允聞而反誅之，乃反譖隱公於子允曰：「隱公欲遂立，去子，子其圖之。

translations.literal: Hui feared that Yun would hear and turn to punish him, so instead he slandered Duke Yin to Yun, saying: 'Duke Yin wishes to take the throne permanently, removing you. You should plan for it.
translations.idiomatic: Hui feared that Yun would learn of it and turn to execute him, so instead he slandered Duke Yin to Yun, saying: 'Duke Yin intends to claim the throne permanently, eliminating you. You should take measures.

sentences.zh: 請為子殺隱公。」

translations.literal: I beg to kill Duke Yin for you.'
translations.idiomatic: I request to assassinate Duke Yin for you.'

sentences.zh: 子允許諾。

translations.literal: Prince Yun agreed.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Yun consented.

sentences.zh: 十一月，隱公祭鐘巫，齊于社圃，館于蒍氏。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, Duke Yin sacrificed to the Bell Spirit, purified himself at the She Orchard, and lodged at the Kuai family.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Duke Yin made offerings to the Bell Spirit, purified himself at the She Orchard, and stayed at the Kuai family's residence.

sentences.zh: 揮使人殺隱公于蒍氏，而立子允為君，是為桓公。

translations.literal: Hui sent someone to kill Duke Yin at the Kuai family, and established Prince Yun as ruler. This is Duke Huan.
translations.idiomatic: Hui dispatched someone to assassinate Duke Yin at the Kuai family's residence, and installed Prince Yun as ruler. He is called Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公元年，鄭以璧易天子之許田。

translations.literal: In Duke Huan's first year, Zheng exchanged a jade disk for the king's Xu Fields.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huan's first year, Zheng traded a jade disk for the king's Xu Fields.

sentences.zh: 二年，以宋之賂鼎入於太廟，君子譏之。

translations.literal: In his second year, he brought the bribe tripod from Song into the Grand Temple. The noble men criticized it.
translations.idiomatic: In his second year, he placed the bribe tripod from Song in the Grand Temple. The gentlemen censured it.

sentences.zh: 三年，使揮迎婦于齊為夫人。

translations.literal: In his third year, he sent Hui to welcome a wife from Qi to be his consort.
translations.idiomatic: In his third year, he dispatched Hui to bring a bride from Qi to be his principal wife.

sentences.zh: 六年，夫人生子，與桓公同日，故名曰同。

translations.literal: In his sixth year, the consort gave birth to a son on the same day as Duke Huan, therefore he was named Tong.
translations.idiomatic: In his sixth year, the consort bore a son on the same day as Duke Huan, so he was called Tong.

sentences.zh: 同長，為太子。

translations.literal: When Tong grew up, he became the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: When Tong matured, he became the heir apparent.

sentences.zh: 十六年，會于曹，伐鄭，入厲公。

translations.literal: In his sixteenth year, he met at Cao, attacked Zheng, and restored Duke Li.
translations.idiomatic: In his sixteenth year, he held a meeting at Cao, campaigned against Zheng, and reinstated Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 十八年春，公將有行，遂與夫人如齊。

translations.literal: In his eighteenth year, spring, the duke was about to travel, and so went with his consort to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In his eighteenth year, during spring, the duke was planning a journey, so he went with his principal wife to Qi.

sentences.zh: 申繻諫止，公不聽，遂如齊。

translations.literal: Shen Xu advised against it, but the duke did not listen, and so went to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Xu admonished him to stop, but the duke would not heed, and therefore went to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊襄公通桓公夫人。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang of Qi had illicit relations with Duke Huan's consort.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang of Qi seduced Duke Huan's principal wife.

sentences.zh: 公怒夫人，夫人以告齊侯。

translations.literal: The duke became angry with his consort. The consort told Duke Xiang of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The duke grew furious with his principal wife. She informed Duke Xiang of Qi.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙子，齊襄公饗公，公醉，使公子彭生抱魯桓公，因命彭生摺其脅，公死于車。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, bingzi day, Duke Xiang of Qi feasted the duke. The duke became drunk, so he had Prince Peng Sheng embrace Duke Huan of Lu, and then commanded Peng Sheng to squeeze his ribs. The duke died in the carriage.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, on the bingzi day of the fourth month, Duke Xiang of Qi hosted a banquet for the duke. The duke got drunk, so he had Prince Peng Sheng embrace Duke Huan of Lu, then ordered Peng Sheng to crush his ribs. The duke died in the chariot.

sentences.zh: 魯人告于齊曰：「寡君畏君之威，不敢寧居，來修好禮。

translations.literal: The people of Lu informed Qi, saying: 'Our humble ruler fears your lordship's might, not daring to rest peacefully, came to cultivate good relations.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu told Qi: 'Our humble ruler fears your lordship's power, not daring to settle comfortably, came to improve friendly relations.

sentences.zh: 禮成而不反，無所歸咎，請得彭生除丑於諸侯。」

translations.literal: The rites were completed but he did not return. There is nowhere to place the blame. We request to obtain Peng Sheng to remove the shame from the feudal lords.'
translations.idiomatic: The ceremonies were completed but he did not return. There is no one to blame. We request to get Peng Sheng to eliminate the disgrace before the feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 齊人殺彭生以說魯。

translations.literal: The people of Qi killed Peng Sheng to appease Lu.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi executed Peng Sheng to satisfy Lu.

sentences.zh: 立太子同，是為莊公。

translations.literal: They established the crown prince Tong. This is Duke Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: They installed the heir apparent Tong. He is called Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊公母夫人因留齊，不敢歸魯。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang's mother, the consort, consequently remained in Qi, not daring to return to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang's mother, the principal wife, therefore stayed in Qi, not daring to return to Lu.

sentences.zh: 莊公五年冬，伐衛，內衛惠公。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhuang's fifth year, winter, he attacked Wei, restoring Duke Hui of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhuang's fifth year, during winter, he campaigned against Wei, reinstating Duke Hui of Wei.

sentences.zh: 八年，齊公子糾來奔。

translations.literal: In his eighth year, Prince Jiu of Qi came fleeing.
translations.idiomatic: In his eighth year, Prince Jiu of Qi arrived as a refugee.

sentences.zh: 九年，魯欲內子糾於齊，後桓公，桓公發兵擊魯，魯急，殺子糾。

translations.literal: In his ninth year, Lu wished to send Prince Jiu into Qi, behind Duke Huan. Duke Huan dispatched troops to attack Lu. Lu was distressed and killed Prince Jiu.
translations.idiomatic: In his ninth year, Lu wanted to send Prince Jiu to Qi, supporting Duke Huan. Duke Huan sent forces to attack Lu. Lu was desperate and killed Prince Jiu.

sentences.zh: 召忽死。

translations.literal: Zhao Hu died.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Hu died.

sentences.zh: 齊告魯生致管仲。

translations.literal: Qi informed Lu to deliver Guan Zhong alive.
translations.idiomatic: Qi told Lu to hand over Guan Zhong alive.

sentences.zh: 魯人施伯曰：「齊欲得管仲，非殺之也，將用之，用之則為魯患。

translations.literal: The Lu person Shi Bo said: 'Qi wishes to obtain Guan Zhong, not to kill him. They will employ him. Employing him will become a calamity for Lu.
translations.idiomatic: The Lu man Shi Bo said: 'Qi wants to get Guan Zhong, not to execute him. They will use him. Using him will become a disaster for Lu.

sentences.zh: 不如殺，以其尸與之。」

translations.literal: It would be better to kill him and give his corpse to them.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to kill him and give them his body.'

sentences.zh: 莊公不聽，遂囚管仲與齊。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang did not listen, and so imprisoned Guan Zhong and gave him to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang would not heed, and so imprisoned Guan Zhong and handed him to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊人相管仲。

translations.literal: The people of Qi made Guan Zhong their chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi appointed Guan Zhong as their chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十三年，魯莊公與曹沬會齊桓公於柯，曹沬劫齊桓公，求魯侵地，已盟而釋桓公。

translations.literal: In his thirteenth year, Duke Zhuang of Lu and Cao Gui met Duke Huan of Qi at Ke. Cao Gui abducted Duke Huan of Qi, demanding Lu's invaded territory. After making the covenant, he released Duke Huan.
translations.idiomatic: In his thirteenth year, Duke Zhuang of Lu and Cao Gui met Duke Huan of Qi at Ke. Cao Gui held Duke Huan hostage, demanding the territory Lu had invaded. After concluding the alliance, he freed Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓公欲背約，管仲諫，卒歸魯侵地。

translations.literal: Duke Huan wished to break the covenant. Guan Zhong advised against it. In the end they returned Lu's invaded territory.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan wanted to renege on the agreement. Guan Zhong admonished him. Ultimately they returned the territory invaded from Lu.

sentences.zh: 十五年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: In his fifteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi first became hegemon.
translations.idiomatic: In his fifteenth year, Duke Huan of Qi first became the hegemon.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，莊公如齊觀社。

translations.literal: In his twenty-third year, Duke Zhuang went to Qi to observe the suburban sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: In his twenty-third year, Duke Zhuang went to Qi to watch the suburban sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，初，莊公筑臺臨黨氏，見孟女，說而愛之，許立為夫人，割臂以盟。

translations.literal: In his thirty-second year, initially, Duke Zhuang built a tower overlooking the Dang family, saw the Meng woman, was pleased and loved her, promised to establish her as his consort, cut his arm to make covenant.
translations.idiomatic: In his thirty-second year, at first, Duke Zhuang built a tower overlooking the Dang family residence, saw the Meng woman, was pleased and fell in love with her, promised to make her his principal wife, and cut his arm to seal the pact.

sentences.zh: 孟女生子斑。

translations.literal: The Meng woman gave birth to a son Ban.
translations.idiomatic: The Meng woman bore a son named Ban.

sentences.zh: 斑長，說梁氏女，往觀。

translations.literal: Ban grew up, was pleased with the Liang family woman, went to observe her.
translations.idiomatic: Ban matured, took a fancy to the Liang family woman, went to see her.

sentences.zh: 圉人犖自墻外與梁氏女戲。

translations.literal: The stableman Luo from outside the wall flirted with the Liang family woman.
translations.idiomatic: The groom Luo flirted with the Liang family woman from outside the wall.

sentences.zh: 斑怒，鞭犖。

translations.literal: Ban was angry, whipped Luo.
translations.idiomatic: Ban became furious, lashed Luo with his whip.

sentences.zh: 莊公聞之，曰：「犖有力焉，遂殺之，是未可鞭而置也。」

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang heard of it, said: 'Luo has strength. He then killed him. This is not someone who can be whipped and set aside.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang heard of it, said: 'Luo has great strength. He then had him killed. This is not someone who can be whipped and ignored.'

sentences.zh: 斑未得殺。

translations.literal: Ban had not yet been able to kill him.
translations.idiomatic: Ban had not yet succeeded in killing him.

sentences.zh: 會莊公有疾。

translations.literal: It happened that Duke Zhuang fell ill.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Duke Zhuang fell ill.

sentences.zh: 莊公有三弟，長曰慶父，次曰叔牙，次曰季友。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang had three younger brothers: the eldest called Qing Fu, the middle called Shu Ya, the youngest called Ji You.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had three younger brothers: the eldest named Qing Fu, the middle named Shu Ya, the youngest named Ji You.

sentences.zh: 莊公取齊女為夫人曰哀姜。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang took a Qi woman as his consort, named Ai Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang married a woman from Qi as his principal wife, called Ai Jiang.

sentences.zh: 哀姜無子。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang had no sons.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang bore no children.

sentences.zh: 哀姜娣曰叔姜，生子開。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang's younger sister called Shu Jiang gave birth to a son Kai.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang's younger sister named Shu Jiang bore a son named Kai.

sentences.zh: 莊公無適嗣，愛孟女，欲立其子斑。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang had no proper heir, loved the Meng woman, wished to establish her son Ban.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had no legitimate successor, favored the Meng woman, wanted to make her son Ban the heir.

sentences.zh: 莊公病，而問嗣於弟叔牙。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang fell ill, and consulted his younger brother Shu Ya about the succession.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang became ill, and asked his younger brother Shu Ya about the succession.

sentences.zh: 叔牙曰：「一繼一及，魯之常也。

translations.literal: Shu Ya said: 'One succeeds one, one extends to another, this is Lu's constant practice.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Ya said: 'One inherits from one, one passes to another - this is Lu's established custom.

sentences.zh: 慶父在，可為嗣，君何憂？」

translations.literal: Qing Fu is present, can be the successor. Why does my lord worry?'
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu is here, he can be the heir. Why does my lord worry?'

sentences.zh: 莊公患叔牙欲立慶父，退而問季友。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang was concerned that Shu Ya wished to establish Qing Fu, withdrew and consulted Ji You.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang worried that Shu Ya wanted to install Qing Fu, so he withdrew and asked Ji You.

sentences.zh: 季友曰：「請以死立斑也。」

translations.literal: Ji You said: 'I beg to die establishing Ban.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji You said: 'I am willing to die to establish Ban.'

sentences.zh: 莊公曰：「曩者叔牙欲立慶父，柰何？」

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang said: 'Formerly Shu Ya wished to establish Qing Fu, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang said: 'Earlier Shu Ya wanted to install Qing Fu, what should we do?'

sentences.zh: 季友以莊公命命牙待於鍼巫氏，使鍼季劫飲叔牙以鴆，曰：「飲此則有後奉祀；

translations.literal: Ji You, by Duke Zhuang's command, ordered Ya to wait at the Zhen Wu family, had Zhen Ji force Shu Ya to drink poison, saying: 'Drink this and you will have descendants to continue the sacrifices;
translations.idiomatic: Ji You, on Duke Zhuang's orders, commanded Ya to wait at the Zhen Wu family, had Zhen Ji compel Shu Ya to drink poison, saying: 'Drink this and you will have descendants to maintain the sacrifices;

sentences.zh: 不然，死且無後。」

translations.literal: If not, you will die and have no descendants.'
translations.idiomatic: Otherwise, you will die without heirs.'

sentences.zh: 牙遂飲鴆而死，魯立其子為叔孫氏。

translations.literal: Ya then drank the poison and died. Lu established his son as the Shu Sun clan.
translations.idiomatic: Ya then drank the poison and died. Lu made his son the founder of the Shu Sun clan.

sentences.zh: 八月癸亥，莊公卒，季友竟立子斑為君，如莊公命。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, guihai day, Duke Zhuang died. Ji You finally established Prince Ban as ruler, as Duke Zhuang commanded.
translations.idiomatic: On the guihai day of the eighth month, Duke Zhuang died. Ji You ultimately installed Prince Ban as ruler, fulfilling Duke Zhuang's command.

sentences.zh: 侍喪，舍于黨氏。

translations.literal: Attending the mourning, he lodged at the Dang family.
translations.idiomatic: While serving the mourning rites, he stayed at the Dang family residence.

sentences.zh: 先時慶父與哀姜私通，欲立哀姜娣子開。

translations.literal: Previously Qing Fu had illicit relations with Ai Jiang, wishing to establish Ai Jiang's younger sister's son Kai.
translations.idiomatic: Earlier, Qing Fu had an affair with Ai Jiang, wanting to install Ai Jiang's younger sister's son Kai.

sentences.zh: 及莊公卒而季友立斑，十月己未，慶父使圉人犖殺魯公子斑於黨氏。

translations.literal: When Duke Zhuang died and Ji You established Ban, in the tenth month jisi day, Qing Fu had the groom Luo kill Lu's Prince Ban at the Dang family.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Zhuang died and Ji You installed Ban, on the jisi day of the tenth month, Qing Fu had the stableman Luo assassinate Lu's Prince Ban at the Dang family.

sentences.zh: 季友奔陳。

translations.literal: Ji You fled to Chen.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You fled to Chen.

sentences.zh: 慶父竟立莊公子開，是為湣公。

translations.literal: Qing Fu ultimately established Duke Zhuang's son Kai. This is Duke Min.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu finally installed Duke Zhuang's son Kai. He is called Duke Min.

sentences.zh: 湣公二年，慶父與哀姜通益甚。

translations.literal: In Duke Min's second year, Qing Fu's relations with Ai Jiang became increasingly intimate.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Min's second year, Qing Fu's affair with Ai Jiang grew even more intense.

sentences.zh: 哀姜與慶父謀殺湣公而立慶父。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang and Qing Fu plotted to kill Duke Min and establish Qing Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang and Qing Fu conspired to assassinate Duke Min and install Qing Fu.

sentences.zh: 慶父使卜齮襲殺湣公於武闈。

translations.literal: Qing Fu had Bo Xi ambush and kill Duke Min at the Wu Gate.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu sent Bo Xi to assassinate Duke Min at the Wu Gate.

sentences.zh: 季友聞之，自陳與湣公弟申如邾，請魯求內之。

translations.literal: Ji You heard of it. From Chen, together with Duke Min's younger brother Shen, he went to Zhu, requesting that Lu invite him back.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You heard about it. From Chen, together with Duke Min's younger brother Shen, he went to Zhu and asked Lu to invite him back.

sentences.zh: 魯人欲誅慶父。

translations.literal: The people of Lu wished to execute Qing Fu.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu wanted to execute Qing Fu.

sentences.zh: 慶父恐，奔莒。

translations.literal: Qing Fu feared and fled to Ju.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu became afraid and fled to Ju.

sentences.zh: 於是季友奉子申入，立之，是為釐公。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ji You escorted Zi Shen in and established him. This is Duke Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Ji You brought Zi Shen back and installed him. He is called Duke Xi.

sentences.zh: 釐公亦莊公少子。

translations.literal: Duke Xi was also Duke Zhuang's youngest son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xi was also Duke Zhuang's youngest son.

sentences.zh: 哀姜恐，奔邾。

translations.literal: Ai Jiang feared and fled to Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang became afraid and fled to Zhu.

sentences.zh: 季友以賂如莒求慶父，慶父歸，使人殺慶父，慶父請奔，弗聽，乃使大夫奚斯行哭而往。

translations.literal: Ji You went to Ju with bribes to seek Qing Fu. Qing Fu returned. He sent someone to kill Qing Fu. Qing Fu requested to flee but was not permitted. He then had the grandee Xi Si go weeping to him.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You went to Ju with bribes to demand Qing Fu's return. Qing Fu came back. Ji You sent someone to assassinate Qing Fu. Qing Fu asked to flee but was denied permission. So Ji You had the grandee Xi Si go to him while pretending to weep.

sentences.zh: 慶父聞奚斯音，乃自殺。

translations.literal: Qing Fu heard Xi Si's voice and committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Fu heard Xi Si's voice and killed himself.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公聞哀姜與慶父亂以危魯，及召之邾而殺之，以其尸歸，戮之魯。

translations.literal: Duke Huan of Qi heard that Ai Jiang and Qing Fu had caused chaos and endangered Lu. He summoned her to Zhu and killed her, then returned with her corpse and displayed it in Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi heard about the affair between Ai Jiang and Qing Fu that endangered Lu. He summoned her to Zhu and had her executed, then brought her corpse back to Lu for public display.

sentences.zh: 魯釐公請而葬之。

translations.literal: Duke Xi of Lu requested and buried her.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xi of Lu requested permission and buried her.

sentences.zh: 季友母陳女，故亡在陳，陳故佐送季友及子申。

translations.literal: Ji You's mother was a woman of Chen. Therefore he had fled to Chen. Chen had assisted in escorting Ji You and Zi Shen.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You's mother was from Chen, so he had fled there. Chen helped escort Ji You and Zi Shen back.

sentences.zh: 季友之將生也，父魯桓公使人卜之，曰：「男也，其名曰『友』，閒于兩社，為公室輔。

translations.literal: When Ji You was about to be born, his father Duke Huan of Lu had someone divine about it, saying: "It is a boy. His name shall be 'You'. He will mediate between the two altars, becoming an auxiliary to the ducal house.
translations.idiomatic: Before Ji You was born, his father Duke Huan of Lu had a divination performed, which said: "It will be a boy. Name him 'You'. He will stand between the two altars, becoming a support to the ducal house.

sentences.zh: 季友亡，則魯不昌。」

translations.literal: If Ji You perishes, then Lu will not prosper."
translations.idiomatic: If Ji You dies, then Lu will not flourish."

sentences.zh: 及生，有文在掌曰「友」，遂以名之，號為成季。

translations.literal: When he was born, there was writing on his palm saying "You". He was thus named accordingly and called Cheng Ji.
translations.idiomatic: When he was born, there were characters on his palm saying "You". He was named accordingly and styled Cheng Ji.

sentences.zh: 其後為季氏，慶父後為孟氏也。

translations.literal: His descendants became the Ji clan. Qing Fu's descendants became the Meng clan.
translations.idiomatic: His descendants became the Ji clan. Qing Fu's descendants became the Meng clan.

sentences.zh: 釐公元年，以汶陽鄪封季友。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's first year, he enfeoffed Ji You with Meng in Wen Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's first year, he granted Ji You the fief of Meng in Wen Yang.

sentences.zh: 季友為相。

translations.literal: Ji You became prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You served as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉裏克殺其君奚齊、卓子。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Jin's Li Ke assassinated his rulers Xi Qi and Zhuo Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Li Ke of Jin assassinated his rulers Xi Qi and Zhuo Zi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公率釐公討晉亂，至高梁而還，立晉惠公。

translations.literal: Duke Huan of Qi led Duke Xi to punish the Jin disorder. They reached Gao Liang and returned, establishing Duke Hui of Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi led Duke Xi to quell the Jin disturbances. They reached Gao Liang and returned, installing Duke Hui of Jin.

sentences.zh: 十七年，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉文公即位。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin took the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen of Jin ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，釐公卒，子興立，是為文公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Duke Xi died. His son Xing succeeded him. This is Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Duke Xi died. His son Xing succeeded him. He is called Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公元年，楚太子商臣弒其父成王，代立。

translations.literal: In Duke Wen's first year, Chu's heir apparent Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and took his place.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wen's first year, Chu's crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and usurped the throne.

sentences.zh: 三年，文公朝晉襄父。

translations.literal: In the third year, Duke Wen paid court to Jin's Xiang Fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Duke Wen went to court Jin's Xiang Fu.

sentences.zh: 十一年十月甲午，魯敗翟于咸，獲長翟喬如，富父終甥舂其喉，以戈殺之，埋其首於子駒之門，以命宣伯。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, tenth month, jiawu day, Lu defeated the Di at Xian, capturing the Chang Di Qiao Ru. Fu Fu Zhong Sheng pounded his throat with a spear and killed him, burying his head at Zi Ju's gate, thereby appointing Xuan Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, on the jiawu day of the tenth month, Lu defeated the Di at Xian and captured the Chang Di Qiao Ru. Fu Fu Zhong Sheng crushed his throat with a spear and killed him, burying his head at Zi Ju's gate, thus appointing Xuan Bo.

sentences.zh: 初，宋武公之世，鄋瞞伐宋，司徒皇父帥師御之，以敗翟于長丘，獲長翟緣斯。

translations.literal: Previously, in Duke Wu of Song's time, Mang Man attacked Song. The Minister of Works Huang Fu led troops to resist them, thereby defeating the Di at Chang Qiu and capturing the Chang Di Yuan Si.
translations.idiomatic: Earlier, during Duke Wu of Song's reign, Mang Man attacked Song. The Minister of Works Huang Fu led troops to defend against them, defeating the Di at Chang Qiu and capturing the Chang Di Yuan Si.

sentences.zh: 晉之滅路，獲喬如弟棼如。

translations.literal: When Jin extinguished Lu, they captured Qiao Ru's younger brother Fen Ru.
translations.idiomatic: When Jin destroyed Lu, they captured Qiao Ru's younger brother Fen Ru.

sentences.zh: 齊惠公二年，鄋瞞伐齊，齊王子城父獲其弟榮如，埋其首於北門。

translations.literal: In Duke Hui of Qi's second year, Mang Man attacked Qi. Qi's noble Zi Cheng Fu captured his younger brother Rong Ru, burying his head at the north gate.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui of Qi's second year, Mang Man attacked Qi. Qi's noble Zi Cheng Fu captured his younger brother Rong Ru and buried his head at the north gate.

sentences.zh: 衛人獲其季弟簡如。

translations.literal: The people of Wei captured his youngest brother Jian Ru.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Wei captured his youngest brother Jian Ru.

sentences.zh: 鄋瞞由是遂亡。

translations.literal: Mang Man from this point on consequently perished.
translations.idiomatic: Mang Man consequently perished from this point on.

sentences.zh: 十五年，季文子使於晉。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Ji Wen Zi was sent on a mission to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Ji Wen Zi was sent as envoy to Jin.

sentences.zh: 十八年二月，文公卒。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, second month, Duke Wen died.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, in the second month, Duke Wen died.

sentences.zh: 文公有二妃：長妃齊女為哀姜，生子惡及視；

translations.literal: Duke Wen had two consorts: the senior consort was a Qi woman called Ai Jiang, who bore sons E and Shi;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen had two consorts: the senior consort was a woman from Qi called Ai Jiang, who gave birth to sons E and Shi;

sentences.zh: 次妃敬嬴，嬖愛，生子俀。

translations.literal: The junior consort Jing Ying was favored and beloved, bearing son You.
translations.idiomatic: The junior consort Jing Ying was especially favored and loved, bearing son You.

sentences.zh: 俀私事襄仲，襄仲欲立之，叔仲曰不可。

translations.literal: You privately served Xiang Zhong. Xiang Zhong wished to establish him. Shu Zhong said it was not permissible.
translations.idiomatic: You privately served Xiang Zhong. Xiang Zhong wanted to install him as ruler. Shu Zhong said it was not permissible.

sentences.zh: 襄仲請齊惠公，惠公新立，欲親魯，許之。

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong petitioned Duke Hui of Qi. Duke Hui had newly taken the throne and wished to be close to Lu, so he agreed.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong appealed to Duke Hui of Qi. Duke Hui had recently ascended the throne and wanted good relations with Lu, so he consented.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，襄仲殺子惡及視而立俀，是為宣公。

translations.literal: In winter, tenth month, Xiang Zhong killed Zi E and Shi and established You. This is Duke Xuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, Xiang Zhong assassinated Zi E and Shi and installed You. He is called Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 哀姜歸齊，哭而過市，曰：「天乎！

translations.literal: Ai Jiang returned to Qi, weeping as she passed through the market, saying: "Heaven above!
translations.idiomatic: Ai Jiang returned to Qi, crying as she passed through the marketplace, saying: "Oh heaven!

sentences.zh: 襄仲為不道，殺適立庶！」

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong acts without righteousness, killing the legitimate heir and establishing the concubine's son!"
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong acts unrighteously, killing the proper heir and installing the son of a concubine!"

sentences.zh: 市人皆哭，魯人謂之「哀姜」。

translations.literal: All the people of the market wept. The people of Lu called her "Ai Jiang".
translations.idiomatic: All the marketplace people wept. The people of Lu referred to her as "Ai Jiang".

sentences.zh: 魯由此公室卑，三桓彊。

translations.literal: From this Lu's ducal house declined, the Three Huan grew strong.
translations.idiomatic: From this point, Lu's ducal house weakened while the Three Huan strengthened.

sentences.zh: 宣公俀十二年，楚莊王彊，圍鄭。

translations.literal: In Duke Xuan You's twelfth year, Chu's King Zhuang became strong and besieged Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xuan's twelfth year, King Zhuang of Chu grew powerful and besieged Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭伯降，復國之。

translations.literal: The Lord of Zheng submitted, so he restored the state to him.
translations.idiomatic: The ruler of Zheng surrendered, so he restored the state to him.

sentences.zh: 十八年，宣公卒，子成公黑肱立，是為成公。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Duke Xuan died. His son Duke Cheng Hei Gong succeeded him. This is Duke Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Xuan died. His son Hei Gong succeeded him. He is called Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 季文子曰：「使我殺適立庶失大援者，襄仲。」

translations.literal: Ji Wen Zi said: "The one who made me kill the legitimate heir and establish the concubine's son, thus losing our great ally, was Xiang Zhong."
translations.idiomatic: Ji Wen Zi said: "The one who caused me to kill the proper heir and install the son of a concubine, thus losing our major ally, was Xiang Zhong."

sentences.zh: 襄仲立宣公，公孫歸父有寵。

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong established Duke Xuan. Gong Sun Gui Fu was favored.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong installed Duke Xuan. Gong Sun Gui Fu was in favor.

sentences.zh: 宣公欲去三桓，與晉謀伐三桓。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan wished to remove the Three Huan and plotted with Jin to attack the Three Huan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan wanted to eliminate the Three Huan and conspired with Jin to attack the Three Huan.

sentences.zh: 會宣公卒，季文子怨之，歸父奔齊。

translations.literal: When Duke Xuan died, Ji Wen Zi resented it. Gui Fu fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Upon Duke Xuan's death, Ji Wen Zi was resentful. Gui Fu fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 成公二年春，齊伐取我隆。

translations.literal: In Duke Cheng's second year, spring, Qi attacked and took our Long.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Cheng's second year, during spring, Qi attacked and seized our Long territory.

sentences.zh: 夏，公與晉郤克敗齊頃公於砹齊復歸我侵地。

translations.literal: In summer, the duke and Jin's Xi Ke defeated Qi's Duke Qing at Ai. Qi returned our invaded territories.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, the duke and Xi Ke of Jin defeated Duke Qing of Qi at Ai. Qi restored our occupied lands.

sentences.zh: 四年，成公如晉，晉景公不敬魯。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Duke Cheng went to Jin. Jin's Duke Jing was disrespectful to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Duke Cheng went to Jin. Duke Jing of Jin was disrespectful toward Lu.

sentences.zh: 魯欲背晉合於楚，或諫，乃不。

translations.literal: Lu wished to abandon Jin and ally with Chu. Some advised against it, so they did not.
translations.idiomatic: Lu wanted to desert Jin and join with Chu. Some remonstrated, so they did not.

sentences.zh: 十年，成公如晉。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Duke Cheng went to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Cheng went to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉景公卒，因留成公送葬，魯諱之。

translations.literal: Duke Jing of Jin died. They detained Duke Cheng to attend the funeral. Lu considered it an insult.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Jin died. They kept Duke Cheng to attend the burial rites. Lu took offense at this.

sentences.zh: 十五年，始與吳王壽夢會鐘離。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, they first met with Wu King Shou Meng at Zhong Li.
