translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, they first met King Shou Meng of Wu at Zhong Li.

sentences.zh: 十六年，宣伯告晉，欲誅季文子。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Xuan Bo informed Jin, wishing to execute Ji Wen Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Xuan Bo reported to Jin, wanting to execute Ji Wen Zi.

sentences.zh: 文子有義，晉人弗許。

translations.literal: Wen Zi had righteousness. The Jin people did not permit it.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zi was righteous. The people of Jin did not allow it.

sentences.zh: 十八年，成公卒，子午立，是為襄公。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Duke Cheng died. His son Wu succeeded him. This is Duke Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Duke Cheng died. His son Wu succeeded him. He is called Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 是時襄公三歲也。

translations.literal: At this time Duke Xiang was three years old.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Duke Xiang was three years old.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，晉立悼公。

translations.literal: In Duke Xiang's first year, Jin established Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang's first year, Jin installed Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 往年冬，晉欒書弒其君厲公。

translations.literal: In the previous year's winter, Jin's Luan Shu assassinated his ruler Duke Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the previous winter, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 四年，襄公朝晉。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Duke Xiang paid court to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Duke Xiang went to court in Jin.

sentences.zh: 五年，季文子卒。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Ji Wen Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Ji Wen Zi died.

sentences.zh: 家無衣帛之妾，廄無食粟之馬，府無金玉，以相三君。

translations.literal: His household had no concubines clothed in silk. His stables had no horses eating grain. His treasury had no gold or jade. With this he served three rulers.
translations.idiomatic: His household lacked concubines dressed in silk. His stables lacked horses fed on grain. His treasury lacked gold and jade. With this he served three rulers.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「季文子廉忠矣。」

translations.literal: The noble man said: "Ji Wen Zi was incorruptible and loyal."
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman said: "Ji Wen Zi was incorruptible and loyal."

sentences.zh: 九年，與晉伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, together with Jin they attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, together with Jin they campaigned against Zheng.

sentences.zh: 晉悼公冠襄公於衛，季武子從，相行禮。

translations.literal: Jin's Duke Dao performed the capping ceremony for Duke Xiang in Wei. Ji Wu Zi accompanied him and assisted with the rituals.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao of Jin performed the capping ceremony for Duke Xiang in Wei. Ji Wu Zi accompanied him and officiated the rites.

sentences.zh: 十一年，三桓氏分為三軍。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, the Three Huan clans divided into three armies.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, the Three Huan clans divided the state into three armies.

sentences.zh: 十二年，朝晉。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he paid court to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he went to court in Jin.

sentences.zh: 十六年，晉平公即位。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Duke Ping of Jin took the throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Duke Ping of Jin ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，朝晉平公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, he paid court to Duke Ping of Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, he went to court Duke Ping of Jin.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，孔丘生。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Kong Qiu was born.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Confucius was born.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，齊崔杼弒其君莊公，立其弟景公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Qi's Cui Zhu assassinated his ruler Duke Zhuang and installed his younger brother Duke Jing.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Cui Zhu of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Zhuang and installed his younger brother Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，吳延陵季子使魯，問周樂，盡知其意，魯人敬焉。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Wu's Yanling Ji Zi was sent to Lu. He inquired about Zhou music and fully understood its meaning. The people of Lu respected him.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Yanling Ji Zi of Wu came as envoy to Lu. He inquired about Zhou music and completely grasped its meaning. The people of Lu held him in esteem.

sentences.zh: 三十一年六月，襄公卒。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, sixth month, Duke Xiang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, in the sixth month, Duke Xiang died.

sentences.zh: 其九月，太子卒。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, the heir apparent died.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the crown prince died.

sentences.zh: 魯人立齊歸之子裯為君，是為昭公。

translations.literal: The people of Lu installed the son of Qi Gui, Chou, as ruler. This is Duke Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu installed Chou, son of Qi Gui, as ruler. He is called Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公年十九，猶有童心。

translations.literal: Duke Zhao was nineteen years old and still had a childish heart.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao was nineteen years old and still had a childish disposition.

sentences.zh: 穆叔不欲立，曰：「太子死，有母弟可立，不即立長。

translations.literal: Mu Shu did not wish to establish him, saying: "The heir apparent died. There are younger brothers by the same mother who can be established. One should not immediately establish the eldest.
translations.idiomatic: Mu Shu did not want to install him, saying: "The crown prince died. There are uterine younger brothers who can be installed. One should not immediately install the eldest.

sentences.zh: 年鈞擇賢，義鈞則卜之。

translations.literal: If ages are equal, choose the worthy. If righteousness is equal, then divine about it.
translations.idiomatic: When ages are equal, select the worthy. When righteousness is equal, divine about it.

sentences.zh: 今裯非適嗣，且又居喪意不在戚而有喜色，若果立，必為季氏憂。」

translations.literal: Now Chou is not the proper heir, and moreover during mourning his thoughts are not on grief but show happy colors. If he is indeed established, he will certainly become a worry for the Ji clan."
translations.idiomatic: Now Chou is not the legitimate successor, and moreover during mourning his mind is not on sorrow but shows joyful expressions. If he is indeed installed, he will certainly become a concern for the Ji clan."

sentences.zh: 季武子弗聽，卒立之。

translations.literal: Ji Wu Zi did not listen and ultimately established him.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Wu Zi did not heed the advice and finally installed him.

sentences.zh: 比及葬，三易衰。

translations.literal: By the time of the burial, he had changed mourning garments three times.
translations.idiomatic: By the time of burial, he had changed his mourning robes three times.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「是不終也。」

translations.literal: The gentleman said: "This is not seeing it through to the end."
translations.idiomatic: The noble man said: "This does not complete the mourning rites."

sentences.zh: 昭公三年，朝晉至河，晉平公謝還之，魯恥焉。

translations.literal: In Duke Zhao's third year, he went to court Jin but reached the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back. Lu was ashamed.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhao's third year, he went to court in Jin but only reached the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back. Lu felt humiliated.

sentences.zh: 四年，楚靈王會諸侯於申，昭公稱病不往。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Chu's King Ling assembled the feudal lords at Shen. Duke Zhao claimed illness and did not go.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, King Ling of Chu assembled the feudal lords at Shen. Duke Zhao pleaded illness and did not attend.

sentences.zh: 七年，季武子卒。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Ji Wu Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Ji Wu Zi died.

sentences.zh: 八年，楚靈王就章華臺，召昭公。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Chu's King Ling completed the Zhanghua Terrace and summoned Duke Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, King Ling of Chu completed the Zhanghua Terrace and summoned Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公往賀，賜昭公寶器；

translations.literal: Duke Zhao went to congratulate him. He bestowed precious vessels upon Duke Zhao;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao went to offer congratulations. He granted Duke Zhao precious vessels;

sentences.zh: 已而悔，復詐取之。

translations.literal: Soon after he regretted it and deceitfully took them back.
translations.idiomatic: Shortly thereafter he regretted it and fraudulently reclaimed them.

sentences.zh: 十二年，朝晉至河，晉平公謝還之。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he went to court Jin but reached the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he went to court in Jin but only reached the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back.

sentences.zh: 十三年，楚公子棄疾弒其君靈王，代立。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Chu's Prince Qi Ji assassinated his ruler King Ling and took his place.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Prince Qi Ji of Chu assassinated his ruler King Ling and usurped the throne.

sentences.zh: 十五年，朝晉，晉留之葬晉昭公，魯恥之。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, he went to court in Jin. Jin detained him to attend Duke Zhao of Jin's funeral. Lu was ashamed.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he went to court in Jin. Jin kept him to attend Duke Zhao of Jin's burial rites. Lu felt humiliated.

sentences.zh: 二十年，齊景公與晏子狩竟，因入魯問禮。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Duke Jing of Qi and Yan Zi hunted along the border, then entered Lu to inquire about rituals.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Duke Jing of Qi and Yan Zi hunted near the border, then entered Lu to ask about the rites.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，朝晉至河，晉謝還之。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, he went to court Jin but reached the river. Jin apologized and sent him back.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, he went to court in Jin but only reached the river. Jin apologized and sent him back.

sentences.zh: 二十五年春，鸜鵒來巢。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, spring, the phoenix came to nest.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, during spring, the phoenix came to build its nest.

sentences.zh: 師己曰：「文成之世童謠曰『鸜鵒來巢，公在乾侯。

translations.literal: Shi Ji said: "In Duke Wen's time there was a children's rhyme saying 'The phoenix comes to nest, the duke is in Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Ji said: "During Duke Wen's reign there was a nursery rhyme that said 'The phoenix comes to nest, the duke is in Gan Hou.

sentences.zh: 鸜鵒入處，公在外野』。」

translations.literal: The phoenix enters the dwelling, the duke is in the wilds outside'."
translations.idiomatic: The phoenix enters the residence, the duke is in the wilderness outside'."

sentences.zh: 季氏與郈氏鬬雞，季氏芥雞羽，郈氏金距。

translations.literal: The Ji clan and the Hou clan fought cocks. The Ji clan treated their cock's feathers with mustard. The Hou clan gilded their cock's spurs.
translations.idiomatic: The Ji clan and the Hou clan had a cockfight. The Ji clan coated their rooster's feathers with mustard. The Hou clan gilded their rooster's spurs.

sentences.zh: 季平子怒而侵郈氏，郈昭伯亦怒平子。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi became angry and attacked the Hou clan. Hou Zhao Bo also became angry with Ping Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi grew furious and invaded Hou territory. Hou Zhao Bo also grew angry with Ping Zi.

sentences.zh: 臧昭伯之弟會偽讒臧氏，匿季氏，臧昭伯囚季氏人。

translations.literal: Zang Zhao Bo's younger brother Hui falsely slandered the Zang clan and hid with the Ji clan. Zang Zhao Bo imprisoned Ji clan people.
translations.idiomatic: Zang Zhao Bo's younger brother Hui falsely slandered the Zang clan and took refuge with the Ji clan. Zang Zhao Bo imprisoned Ji clan members.

sentences.zh: 季平子怒，囚臧氏老。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi became angry and imprisoned the Zang clan elders.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi grew furious and imprisoned the Zang clan elders.

sentences.zh: 臧、郈氏以難告昭公。

translations.literal: The Zang and Hou clans reported the difficulties to Duke Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The Zang and Hou clans informed Duke Zhao of the crisis.

sentences.zh: 昭公九月戊戌伐季氏，遂入。

translations.literal: Duke Zhao, in the ninth month on wuxu day, attacked the Ji clan and then entered.
translations.idiomatic: On the wuxu day of the ninth month, Duke Zhao attacked the Ji clan and entered their residence.

sentences.zh: 平子登臺請曰：「君以讒不察臣罪，誅之，請遷沂上。」

translations.literal: Ping Zi ascended the tower and pleaded: "My lord, deceived by slander, does not examine my crimes. Execute me. I request to be exiled to Yi Shang."
translations.idiomatic: Ping Zi climbed the tower and begged: "My lord, misled by calumny, does not investigate my offenses. Put me to death. I ask to be banished to Yi Shang."

sentences.zh: 弗許。

translations.literal: He did not permit it.
translations.idiomatic: He refused.

sentences.zh: 請囚於鄪，弗許。

translations.literal: He requested imprisonment in Meng. Not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He requested imprisonment in Meng. Refused.

sentences.zh: 請以五乘亡，弗許。

translations.literal: He requested to flee with five chariots. Not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He requested to escape with five chariots. Refused.

sentences.zh: 子家駒曰：「君其許之。

translations.literal: Zi Jia Ju said: "My lord should permit it.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia Ju said: "My lord should allow it.

sentences.zh: 政自季氏久矣，為徒者眾，眾將合謀。」

translations.literal: Government has been with the Ji clan for a long time. Those who follow them are many. The many will unite in conspiracy."
translations.idiomatic: The Ji clan has held power for a long time. Their followers are numerous. The multitude will conspire together."

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: He did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He refused to heed the advice.

sentences.zh: 郈氏曰：「必殺之。」

translations.literal: The Hou clan said: "We must kill him."
translations.idiomatic: The Hou clan declared: "We must execute him."

sentences.zh: 叔孫氏之臣戾謂其眾曰：「無季氏與有，孰利？」

translations.literal: Shu Sun clan's minister Li said to his followers: "Without the Ji clan or with them, which is better?"
translations.idiomatic: Li, a minister of the Shu Sun clan, asked his followers: "Is it better to have the Ji clan or not to have them?"

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「無季氏是無叔孫氏。」

translations.literal: All said: "Without the Ji clan is without the Shu Sun clan."
translations.idiomatic: They all replied: "Without the Ji clan there is no Shu Sun clan."

sentences.zh: 戾曰：「然，救季氏！」

translations.literal: Li said: "Indeed, save the Ji clan!"
translations.idiomatic: Li declared: "That is right, rescue the Ji clan!"

sentences.zh: 遂敗公師。

translations.literal: They then defeated the duke's army.
translations.idiomatic: They consequently routed the duke's forces.

sentences.zh: 孟懿子聞叔孫氏勝，亦殺郈昭伯。

translations.literal: Meng Yi Zi heard that the Shu Sun clan had won and also killed Hou Zhao Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Yi Zi, hearing that the Shu Sun clan had prevailed, also assassinated Hou Zhao Bo.

sentences.zh: 郈昭伯為公使，故孟氏得之。

translations.literal: Hou Zhao Bo was on the duke's mission, so the Meng clan got him.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Zhao Bo was acting as the duke's envoy, so the Meng clan seized him.

sentences.zh: 三家共伐公，公遂奔。

translations.literal: The three clans jointly attacked the duke. The duke then fled.
translations.idiomatic: The three clans together assaulted the duke. The duke consequently fled.

sentences.zh: 己亥，公至于齊。

translations.literal: On jihai day, the duke arrived in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: On the jihai day, the duke reached Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊景公曰：「請致千社待君。」

translations.literal: Duke Jing of Qi said: "I request to offer a thousand she altars to await my lord."
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi declared: "I ask to provide a thousand she territories to host my lord."

sentences.zh: 子家曰：「棄周公之業而臣於齊，可乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Jia said: "To abandon the Duke of Zhou's legacy and serve as minister to Qi, is this permissible?"
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia exclaimed: "To forsake the Duke of Zhou's heritage and become a vassal of Qi, how can this be acceptable?"

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: They then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: So they ceased.

sentences.zh: 子家曰：「齊景公無信，不如早之晉。」

translations.literal: Zi Jia said: "Duke Jing of Qi has no trustworthiness. It would be better to go to Jin early."
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia declared: "Duke Jing of Qi is untrustworthy. It would be better to go to Jin sooner."

sentences.zh: 弗從。

translations.literal: He did not follow this.
translations.idiomatic: He refused to heed this advice.

sentences.zh: 叔孫見公還，見平子，平子頓首。

translations.literal: Shu Sun saw the duke return. He saw Ping Zi. Ping Zi bowed his head to the ground.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Sun saw the duke return. He met with Ping Zi. Ping Zi prostrated himself.

sentences.zh: 初欲迎昭公，孟孫、季孫後悔，乃止。

translations.literal: At first they wished to welcome Duke Zhao. Meng Sun and Ji Sun later regretted it, so they stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Initially they wanted to welcome Duke Zhao back. Meng Sun and Ji Sun later regretted it, so they ceased.

sentences.zh: 二十六年春，齊伐魯，取鄆而居昭公焉。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, spring, Qi attacked Lu, seized Yun and housed Duke Zhao there.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, during spring, Qi invaded Lu, took Yun and lodged Duke Zhao there.

sentences.zh: 夏，齊景公將內公，令無受魯賂。

translations.literal: In summer, Duke Jing of Qi was about to restore the duke and ordered not to accept Lu's bribes.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Jing of Qi planned to restore the duke and commanded not to accept bribes from Lu.

sentences.zh: 申豐、汝賈許齊臣高龁、子將粟五千庾。

translations.literal: Shen Feng and Ru Jia promised Qi's ministers Gao Que and Zi Jiang five thousand yu of grain.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Feng and Ru Jia pledged five thousand yu of grain to Qi's ministers Gao Que and Zi Jiang.

sentences.zh: 子將言於齊侯曰：「群臣不能事魯君，有異焉。

translations.literal: Zi Jiang spoke to the Duke of Qi saying: "The ministers are unable to serve the Lu ruler. There is something unusual.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jiang told the Duke of Qi: "The ministers cannot serve the Lu ruler. Something is amiss.

sentences.zh: 宋元公為魯如晉，求內之，道卒。

translations.literal: Duke Yuan of Song went to Jin on Lu's behalf to seek to restore him. He died en route.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yuan of Song went to Jin representing Lu to seek his restoration. He died along the way.

sentences.zh: 叔孫昭子求內其君，無病而死。

translations.literal: Shu Sun Zhao Zi sought to restore his lord. He died without illness.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Sun Zhao Zi sought to bring back his ruler. He died without being ill.

sentences.zh: 不知天棄魯乎？

translations.literal: I do not know if heaven has abandoned Lu?
translations.idiomatic: I wonder if heaven has forsaken Lu?

sentences.zh: 抑魯君有罪于鬼神也？

translations.literal: Or if the Lu ruler has offended the spirits?
translations.idiomatic: Or if the Lu ruler has sinned against the spirits?

sentences.zh: 願君且待。」

translations.literal: I wish my lord to wait for now."
translations.idiomatic: I hope my lord will wait for the time being."

sentences.zh: 齊景公從之。

translations.literal: Duke Jing of Qi followed this.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi complied with this.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，昭公如晉，求入。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Zhao went to Jin, seeking entry.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Zhao went to Jin, requesting restoration.

sentences.zh: 季平子私於晉六卿，六卿受季氏賂，諫晉君，晉君乃止，居昭公乾侯。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi had private connections with Jin's six ministers. The six ministers accepted Ji clan bribes, advised the Jin ruler. The Jin ruler then stopped and housed Duke Zhao at Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi had private ties to Jin's six ministers. The six ministers took bribes from the Ji clan and advised the Jin ruler. The Jin ruler then ceased and lodged Duke Zhao at Gan Hou.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，昭公如鄆。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Zhao went to Yun.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Zhao went to Yun.

sentences.zh: 齊景公使人賜昭公書，自謂「主君」。

translations.literal: Duke Jing of Qi sent someone to bestow a letter on Duke Zhao, calling himself "Sovereign Lord".
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi sent someone to present Duke Zhao with a letter, referring to himself as "Sovereign Lord".

sentences.zh: 昭公恥之，怒而去乾侯。

translations.literal: Duke Zhao was ashamed by this, grew angry and left Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao felt humiliated by this, became furious and departed from Gan Hou.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，晉欲內昭公，召季平子。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Jin wished to restore Duke Zhao and summoned Ji Ping Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Jin wanted to bring back Duke Zhao and summoned Ji Ping Zi.

sentences.zh: 平子布衣跣行，因六卿謝罪。

translations.literal: Ping Zi went in plain clothes barefoot, through the six ministers to apologize.
translations.idiomatic: Ping Zi went barefoot in plain clothes and begged forgiveness through the six ministers.

sentences.zh: 六卿為言曰：「晉欲內昭公，眾不從。」

translations.literal: The six ministers spoke on his behalf saying: "Jin wishes to restore Duke Zhao, but the masses will not follow."
translations.idiomatic: The six ministers spoke for him saying: "Jin wants to bring back Duke Zhao, but the people will not comply."

sentences.zh: 晉人止。

translations.literal: The Jin people stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Jin ceased.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，昭公卒於乾侯。

translations.literal: In the thirty-second year, Duke Zhao died at Gan Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, Duke Zhao died at Gan Hou.

sentences.zh: 魯人共立昭公弟宋為君，是為定公。

translations.literal: The people of Lu together established Duke Zhao's younger brother Song as ruler. This is Duke Ding.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lu jointly installed Duke Zhao's younger brother Song as ruler. He is called Duke Ding.

sentences.zh: 定公立，趙簡子問史墨曰：「季氏亡乎？」

translations.literal: After Duke Ding was established, Zhao Jian Zi asked Shi Mo saying: "Will the Ji clan perish?"
translations.idiomatic: Once Duke Ding was installed, Zhao Jian Zi asked Shi Mo: "Will the Ji clan perish?"

sentences.zh: 史墨對曰：「不亡。

translations.literal: Shi Mo replied saying: "It will not perish.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Mo answered: "It will not perish.

sentences.zh: 季友有大功於魯，受鄪為上卿，至于文子、武子，世增其業。

translations.literal: Ji You had great merit toward Lu, received Meng as chief minister. Down to Wen Zi and Wu Zi, each generation increased their estate.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You rendered great service to Lu, received Meng as his fief and became chief minister. Through Wen Zi and Wu Zi, each generation expanded their holdings.

sentences.zh: 魯文公卒，東門遂殺適立庶，魯君於是失國政。

translations.literal: When Duke Wen of Lu died, Dong Men Sui killed the legitimate heir and established a concubine's son. The Lu ruler from this point lost control of state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Upon Duke Wen of Lu's death, Dong Men Sui assassinated the proper heir and installed a son from a concubine. From this point, the Lu ruler lost control of government.

sentences.zh: 政在季氏，於今四君矣。

translations.literal: Government has been with the Ji clan for four rulers now.
translations.idiomatic: Power has resided with the Ji clan for four rulers now.

sentences.zh: 民不知君，何以得國！

translations.literal: If the people do not know their ruler, how can he maintain the state!
translations.idiomatic: If the people do not recognize their ruler, how can he retain the state!

sentences.zh: 是以為君慎器與名，不可以假人。」

translations.literal: Therefore a ruler must be careful with his vessels and titles; they cannot be lent to others."
translations.idiomatic: Therefore a ruler must guard his authority and prestige; they cannot be entrusted to others."

sentences.zh: 定公五年，季平子卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Ding's fifth year, Ji Ping Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ding's fifth year, Ji Ping Zi died.

sentences.zh: 陽虎私怒，囚季桓子，與盟，乃捨之。

translations.literal: Yang Hu was privately angry, imprisoned Ji Huan Zi, made an alliance with him, then released him.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Hu became privately furious, imprisoned Ji Huan Zi, formed an alliance with him, and then released him.

sentences.zh: 七年，齊伐我，取鄆，以為魯陽虎邑以從政。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Qi attacked us, took Yun, and made it Yang Hu's fief in Lu so he could participate in government.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qi invaded us, seized Yun, and granted it as Yang Hu's fief in Lu so he could take part in administration.

sentences.zh: 八年，陽虎欲盡殺三桓適，而更立其所善庶子以代之；

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Yang Hu wished to kill all the Three Huan legitimate heirs and replace them with favored concubine sons;
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Yang Hu wanted to assassinate all the Three Huan's proper heirs and install favored sons of concubines in their place;

sentences.zh: 載季桓子將殺之，桓子詐而得脫。

translations.literal: He loaded Ji Huan Zi into a chariot intending to kill him. Huan Zi deceived him and escaped.
translations.idiomatic: He put Ji Huan Zi in a chariot intending to execute him. Huan Zi tricked him and got away.

sentences.zh: 三桓共攻陽虎，陽虎居陽關。

translations.literal: The Three Huan jointly attacked Yang Hu. Yang Hu resided at Yang Guan.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Huan together assaulted Yang Hu. Yang Hu took refuge at Yang Guan.

sentences.zh: 九年，魯伐陽虎，陽虎奔齊，已而奔晉趙氏。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Lu attacked Yang Hu. Yang Hu fled to Qi, then later fled to the Zhao clan in Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Lu campaigned against Yang Hu. Yang Hu escaped to Qi, then subsequently fled to the Zhao clan in Jin.

sentences.zh: 十年，定公與齊景公會於夾谷，孔子行相事。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Duke Ding and Duke Jing of Qi met at Jia Gu. Confucius performed the duties of minister.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Ding and Duke Jing of Qi met at Jia Gu. Confucius served as minister.

sentences.zh: 齊欲襲魯君，孔子以禮歷階，誅齊淫樂，齊侯懼，乃止，歸魯侵地而謝過。

translations.literal: Qi wished to attack the Lu ruler by surprise. Confucius used ritual to ascend the stairs, executed the Qi lewd musicians. The Qi lord feared, then stopped, returned Lu's invaded territories and apologized.
translations.idiomatic: Qi intended to ambush the Lu ruler. Confucius used ceremony to climb the stairs, executed the Qi depraved musicians. The Qi ruler became afraid, then ceased, returned Lu's occupied lands and offered apology.

sentences.zh: 十二年，使仲由毀三桓城，收其甲兵。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he sent Zhong You to destroy the Three Huan city walls and confiscate their weapons and armor.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he sent Zhong You to demolish the Three Huan's city walls and seize their weapons and armor.

sentences.zh: 孟氏不肯墮城，伐之，不克而止。

translations.literal: The Meng clan refused to tear down the walls. He attacked them but could not conquer them and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The Meng clan refused to demolish the walls. He assaulted them but failed to defeat them and ceased.

sentences.zh: 季桓子受齊女樂，孔子去。

translations.literal: Ji Huan Zi accepted female musicians from Qi. Confucius departed.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Huan Zi accepted female musicians from Qi. Confucius left.

sentences.zh: 十五年，定公卒，子將立，是為哀公。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Duke Ding died. His son Jiang succeeded him. This is Duke Ai.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Duke Ding died. His son Jiang succeeded him. He is called Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀公五年，齊景公卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Ai's fifth year, Duke Jing of Qi died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ai's fifth year, Duke Jing of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 六年，齊田乞弒其君孺子。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qi's Tian Qi assassinated his ruler Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Tian Qi of Qi assassinated his ruler Ru Zi.

sentences.zh: 七年，吳王夫差彊，伐齊，至繒，徵百牢於魯。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Wu King Fu Chai became strong, attacked Qi, reached Zeng, and demanded one hundred sets of sacrificial animals from Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, King Fu Chai of Wu grew powerful, invaded Qi, reached Zeng, and demanded one hundred sacrificial offerings from Lu.

sentences.zh: 季康子使子貢說吳王及太宰嚭，以禮詘之。

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to persuade King Fu Chai of Wu and Grand Steward Kui, using ritual to make them submit.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to convince King Fu Chai of Wu and Grand Steward Kui, using ceremony to bend them.

sentences.zh: 吳王曰：「我文身，不足責禮。」

translations.literal: The Wu king said: "I am tattooed, not enough to demand ritual from."
translations.idiomatic: The Wu king said: "I have tattoos, insufficient to demand ritual propriety from."

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: They then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: So they ceased.

sentences.zh: 吳為鄒伐魯，至城下，盟而去。

translations.literal: Wu on behalf of Zou attacked Lu, reached the city walls, made an alliance and left.
translations.idiomatic: Wu, acting for Zou, invaded Lu, reached the city walls, concluded an alliance and departed.

sentences.zh: 齊伐我，取三邑。

translations.literal: Qi attacked us, taking three towns.
translations.idiomatic: Qi invaded us, seizing three towns.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐齊南邊。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, they attacked Qi's southern border.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, they campaigned against Qi's southern border.

sentences.zh: 齊伐魯。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Qi invaded Lu.

sentences.zh: 季氏用冉有有功，思孔子，孔子自衛歸魯。

translations.literal: The Ji clan employed Ran You who had merit, thought of Confucius. Confucius returned to Lu from Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The Ji clan employed Ran You who had achieved success, missed Confucius. Confucius returned to Lu from Wei.

sentences.zh: 齊田常弒其君簡公於俆州。

translations.literal: Qi's Tian Chang assassinated his ruler Duke Jian at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Jian at Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 孔子請伐之，哀公不聽。

translations.literal: Confucius requested to attack them. Duke Ai did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius asked to invade them. Duke Ai refused to heed.

sentences.zh: 十五年，使子服景伯、子貢為介，適齊，齊歸我侵地。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, he sent Zi Fu Jing Bo and Zi Gong as envoys to Qi. Qi returned our invaded territories.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he sent Zi Fu Jing Bo and Zi Gong as intermediaries to Qi. Qi restored our occupied lands.

sentences.zh: 田常初相，欲親諸侯。

translations.literal: Tian Chang initially as chancellor wished to be close to the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang, newly chancellor, wanted to cultivate relations with the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十六年，孔子卒。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Confucius died.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Confucius died.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，越王句踐滅吳王夫差。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Yue King Gou Jian extinguished Wu King Fu Chai.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, King Gou Jian of Yue destroyed King Fu Chai of Wu.

sentences.zh: 二十七年春，季康子卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, spring, Ji Kang Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, during spring, Ji Kang Zi died.

sentences.zh: 夏，哀公患三桓，將欲因諸侯以劫之，三桓亦患公作難，故君臣多閒。

translations.literal: In summer, Duke Ai was troubled by the Three Huan, intending to use the feudal lords to coerce them. The Three Huan also feared the duke would cause trouble, so ruler and ministers had many estrangements.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Ai was concerned about the Three Huan, planning to use the feudal lords to force them. The Three Huan also feared the duke would create disturbances, so lord and ministers had many divisions.

sentences.zh: 公游于陵阪，遇孟武伯於街，曰：「請問余及死乎？」

translations.literal: The duke was strolling at Ling Ban, encountered Meng Wu Bo on the street, said: "May I ask if I will live to see death?"
translations.idiomatic: The duke was walking at Ling Ban, met Meng Wu Bo on the road, said: "May I ask if I will live to see death?"

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不知也。」

translations.literal: He replied: "I do not know."
translations.idiomatic: He answered: "I do not know."

sentences.zh: 公欲以越伐三桓。

translations.literal: The duke wished to use Yue to attack the Three Huan.
translations.idiomatic: The duke wanted to use Yue to assault the Three Huan.

sentences.zh: 八月，哀公如陘氏。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, Duke Ai went to the Xing clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Duke Ai went to the Xing family.

sentences.zh: 三桓攻公，公奔于衛，去如鄒，遂如越。

translations.literal: The Three Huan attacked the duke. The duke fled to Wei, then went to Zou, and then to Yue.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Huan assaulted the duke. The duke escaped to Wei, then proceeded to Zou, and finally to Yue.

sentences.zh: 國人迎哀公復歸，卒于有山氏。

translations.literal: The people of the state welcomed Duke Ai back. He died at the You Shan clan.
translations.idiomatic: The state's people welcomed Duke Ai back. He died at the You Shan family.

sentences.zh: 子寧立，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Zi Ning succeeded him. This is Duke Dao.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ning succeeded him. He is called Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公之時，三桓勝，魯如小侯，卑於三桓之家。

translations.literal: During Duke Dao's time, the Three Huan prevailed. Lu was like a small marquess, inferior to the Three Huan families.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Dao's era, the Three Huan triumphed. Lu was like a minor marquis, subordinate to the Three Huan households.

sentences.zh: 十三年，三晉滅智伯，分其地有之。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, the Three Jin extinguished Zhi Bo, dividing and possessing his territory.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, the Three Jin destroyed Zhi Bo, dividing and taking his lands.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，悼公卒，子嘉立，是為元公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Dao died. His son Jia succeeded him. This is Duke Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Dao died. His son Jia succeeded him. He is called Duke Yuan.

sentences.zh: 元公二十一年卒，子顯立，是為穆公。

translations.literal: Duke Yuan died in his twenty-first year. His son Xian succeeded him. This is Duke Mu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yuan died in his twenty-first year. His son Xian succeeded him. He is called Duke Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆公三十三年卒，子奮立，是為共公。

translations.literal: Duke Mu died in his thirty-third year. His son Fen succeeded him. This is Duke Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu died in his thirty-third year. His son Fen succeeded him. He is called Duke Gong.

sentences.zh: 共公二十二年卒，子屯立，是為康公。

translations.literal: Duke Gong died in his twenty-second year. His son Tun succeeded him. This is Duke Kang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Gong died in his twenty-second year. His son Tun succeeded him. He is called Duke Kang.

sentences.zh: 康公九年卒，子匽立，是為景公。

translations.literal: Duke Kang died in his ninth year. His son Yi succeeded him. This is Duke Jing.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Kang died in his ninth year. His son Yi succeeded him. He is called Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 景公二十九年卒，子叔立，是為平公。

translations.literal: Duke Jing died in his twenty-ninth year. His son Shu succeeded him. This is Duke Ping.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died in his twenty-ninth year. His son Shu succeeded him. He is called Duke Ping.

sentences.zh: 是時六國皆稱王。

translations.literal: At this time the six states all called themselves kings.
translations.idiomatic: At this time the six states all claimed the title of king.

sentences.zh: 平公十二年，秦惠王卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Ping's twelfth year, Qin's King Hui died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ping's twelfth year, King Hui of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十（二）年，平公卒，子賈立，是為文公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Duke Ping died. His son Jia succeeded him. This is Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Duke Ping died. His son Jia succeeded him. He is called Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公（七）［元］年，楚懷王死于秦。

translations.literal: In Duke Wen's first year, Chu's King Huai died in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wen's first year, King Huai of Chu died in Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，文公卒，子讎立，是為頃公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke Wen died. His son Qiu succeeded him. This is Duke Qing.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Wen died. His son Qiu succeeded him. He is called Duke Qing.

sentences.zh: 頃公二年，秦拔楚之郢，楚頃王東徙于陳。

translations.literal: In Duke Qing's second year, Qin captured Chu's Ying. Chu's King Qing moved east to Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's second year, Qin seized Chu's Ying capital. King Qing of Chu relocated east to Chen.

sentences.zh: 十九年，楚伐我，取徐州。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Chu attacked us, taking Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Chu invaded us, seizing Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，楚考烈王伐滅魯。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Chu's King Kao Lie attacked and extinguished Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, King Kao Lie of Chu invaded and destroyed Lu.

sentences.zh: 頃公亡，遷於下邑，為家人，魯絕祀。

translations.literal: Duke Qing fled, moved to Xia Yi, became a commoner. Lu's sacrifices ceased.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing escaped, relocated to Xia Yi, became a private citizen. Lu's ancestral rites ended.

sentences.zh: 頃公卒于柯。

translations.literal: Duke Qing died at Ke.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing died at Ke.

sentences.zh: 魯起周公至頃公，凡三十四世。

translations.literal: Lu from the Duke of Zhou to Duke Qing, altogether thirty-four generations.
translations.idiomatic: From the Duke of Zhou to Duke Qing, Lu spanned thirty-four generations in total.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余聞孔子稱曰「甚矣魯道之衰也！

translations.literal: The Grand Scribe says: I heard Confucius say "How extreme is the decline of the Lu way!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Scribe says: I heard Confucius declare "How profound is the decline of Lu's principles!

sentences.zh: 洙泗之閒龂龂如也」。

translations.literal: Between the Zhu and Si rivers it was so flourishing."
translations.idiomatic: Between the Zhu and Si rivers it was so vibrant."

sentences.zh: 觀慶父及叔牙閔公之際，何其亂也？

translations.literal: Observe Qing Fu and Shu Ya during Duke Yin's time, how chaotic it was?
translations.idiomatic: Consider Qing Fu and Shu Ya during Duke Yin's reign, how disorderly it was?

sentences.zh: 隱桓之事；

translations.literal: Duke Yin and Duke Huan's affairs;
translations.idiomatic: The matters of Dukes Yin and Huan;

sentences.zh: 襄仲殺適立庶；

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong killed the legitimate heir and established a concubine's son;
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong assassinated the proper heir and installed a son of a concubine;

sentences.zh: 三家北面為臣，親攻昭公，昭公以奔。

translations.literal: The three houses faced north as ministers, personally attacked Duke Zhao, Duke Zhao fled as a result.
translations.idiomatic: The three houses served as ministers facing north, personally assaulted Duke Zhao, causing Duke Zhao to flee.

sentences.zh: 至其揖讓之禮則從矣，而行事何其戾也？

translations.literal: As for their ritual of yielding and offering, they followed it, but their actions, how contrary they were?
translations.idiomatic: Regarding their ceremonies of deference and offering, they complied, but their conduct, how perverse it was?
